A9pHDRZIyXiz7FemcCX7RA.text: Bought their  Mandarin Wheat 6-pack and it was awful. The first taste spoke of Mandarins and ended with an after math of dirty soap water. If their on tap beers vary, I'd give a completely different review, otherwise their canned beer is awful and I'd recommend everyone stay clear!

7zi7XJ-47upjHeeciJl0Tw.text: Loved this place, went to it with my husband as a start to our bar hopping night and it was awesome.  We tried their beer, the fence jumper was amazing! Definitely will come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Bear's Grill & Tap - Phoenix, AZ, United States

M2LCfECJNpqxvCUBStG6zg.text: My second visit here I was surprised to find that the bartender, Larry, remembered what I was drinking. I was impressed, to say the least. The service is always great, and the staff is so friendly. The chicken fajitas are to die for!

qDnp9d8w0itxeQtJXroawg.text: We've been to Bear's twice in the past few weeks, after I happened to notice it on the way to the theater earlier in the month. I enjoy a nice basic sport's bar on occasion since we cut our cable and basically only catch games or fights while out now. My food was average for sports bars both times (the grilled cheese with tomato soup once, and a bowl of tortilla soup another), but my parmesan cheese fries were huge and delicious and my SO liked his BBQ burger so much he got it twice. I really like their beer and their service was fantastic.

RiJz7c4-Plak21Td2r-23w.text: Looking for some late night food on our way home. Mahi mahi tacos were awesome added some chicken wings and a couple glasses of Cabernet. Bartender/waiter was great. Perfect ending to a long night.

jYlXFfH-rSrOWApbA1cK1Q.text: Good food, good beer. Not much to complain about.  I do wish the entree prices were a little more realistic. $12-$13 for bar food is a little steep. Like it or not, this place is a bit of a dive bar, in a complimentary way, so the prices should follow along with that. You don't come to a place with peanut shells all over the place expecting class and sophistication, so I'd rather not pay those sort of prices either.

hFwYTTneME2_sJ9xqyEXCg.text: Walked in here as a change of pace from Pita Jungle next door. Very open and spacious. Huge garage door type of opening behind the first bar lets lots of sunshine and fresh air in.   Jen ordered the beer flight and was a big fan. I'm not a big drinker but the Head to Tale Amber Ale was pretty good for my novice palette.    We had the chicken fingers as an app and even though normally I don't like breaded, theses had a subtle peppery seasoning in the breading which made me want to come back here again just for that and the distinctively different BBQ sauce that came on the side.  Jen and I both ordered prime rib. Didn't know what we wanted at first but it coincidentally was 4pm when they started serving it. Great choice. Jen knows i ca be pretty critical of my food, and when she asked me how it was I said, "Best prime rib I've had in 20 years."  No joke. It could have been that we probably had the first slice and it was also a little luck since our server didn't ask what temp we wanted and yet it came out a perfect medium rare and was sooooooooo good.   Our server was pretty much MIA the majority of the time. Alright guy and other server did check on us. We could have used a little more attention but the meal was so good I pretty much overlooked that part.   On a side note for those who might like to know, the patio is dog friendly and they have a ton of TVs.    I've also read some reviews about not being greeted promptly and poor service. To be honest I can see this just from observing by our experience wasn't all that bad and the food was so damn good we will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Bear's Grill & Tap - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Uncle Bear's Grill & Tap - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Uncle Bear's Grill & Tap - Phoenix, AZ, United States

zC7EGDEkvD9K5u0qQzrD7w.text: Was pleasantly surprised with Uncle Bear's -- the variety of beer, the attention we received and the very good food.  We both had a local beer, my husband had wings and I had a grilled chicken salad.  Both were very good, seasoned just right.  We're so excited to find this gem and will be back.

__m_I4dhMT7O8rEtFszCBQ.text: Poor first impression at the bar Persons at front door were friendly For a Saturday at 2 PM with multiple football games on there was light crowd No one behind the bar at first After a few minutes a blond women came up.  She was very unfriendly. She acted like she was doing me a favor when I asked about the beers.  Perhaps she was unhappy about wearing Christmas outfit that included a necklace of large flashing Christmas lights

WOAZHlmwkmLwS0Wsd3FB8g.text: I have visited Uncle Bear's three times now and each time, the service and food have been consistently delightful. I feel that the staff genuinely want to be there and want to provide the best possible service so that each guest enjoys his or her visit. I've had burgers on each of my visits and have substituted veggie patties each time; the veggie patties are nicely seasoned and have good texture. I particularly like the sweet potato fries: crisp on the outside, steaming hot on the inside. My husband is a self-proclaimed beer snob and said that tonight's stout was  one of Uncle Bear's best beers. (Said stout is a seasonal selection, though.)   Uncle Bear's loves their canine companions and guests can see oodles of framed photos of lovable pooches along the entry and bathroom hallways. I'm not certain if Uncle Bear's allows dogs inside, but I have seen a dog or two accompany his or her human on the patio.  :)

oEYIFBuebxXp9LCkUUwlZw.text: Brew is great but the food could definitely use some work.  I was not impressed.  I would only return for the beers.

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Bear's Grill & Tap - Phoenix, AZ, United States

djMhU9ALm5pcGQflxjlHJA.text: The service we had was extraordinary - our server Kyle was great and on his game.  Answered all questions and kept in communication with us during our stay. Great atmosphere- will be coming back for sure.

W2y4c5WG-4E2Vuwk1aTAmw.text: Food was not good tonight. The Heard Burger meat was smashed flat and full of large chunks of onions. Not sure what changed but unimpressed. The beer was awesome.

0X7v5UXaoRSdZRzchA9MzQ.text: I spoke with the owners about live music at Uncle Bear's, if you see this, will you please contact me? Thanks! 702-234-2590

tkTMdV7qSxHn_FPAvBVjsQ.text: This place is awesome! Came in with my dog Cowboy and everyone was very friendly. Showed him love which is positive. I got wings and a pizza to go. Came out as expected. Thank you guys very much for the great service Larry the bartender tonight was great, and greatly appreciated asked about a beer and he got me what I liked in comparison to what I drink. Will be back and tell friends

7IKbsc-uNI07HxddSzwaXw.text: Uncle Bear's Brewery has a menu that is very diverse in the different selections available. The food was very good and the service was good as well.  Sat on the patio which was a very nice environment and is also dog friendly.

XcGntbuEVsdx5SA6ZkfHYw.text: First time here on Wednesday night. I had a thin crust pizza which wasn't crispy enough for my taste.  I liked the 80's music that was playing but would be nice if they threw in some 90's too.  I had a beer and I loved it...the dog paddle.  I'm going to ride my bike next time so I can enjoy two. Return factor 90%.

dkMBXjp1syYAq2Xhi34CHQ.text: Great wings and awesome salads. My dog Archer loves the patio, very dog friendly. They brew their own beer and their Ocean Beach West Coast IPA is very good. Pub Pretzels are also very good. Casual, pub-sports bar atmosphere. A lot of big screen TVs to watch the game. I will come back for football season for sure.

EbY40BgvxrQumClWKKPDFg.text: This is a frequent hang out on Saturdays.  I live in Gilbert and go specifically to this location.  upon sitting at the bar we are offered our usual tall peanut butter Porter.  The service makes me come back along with the choices of food and beer.  There is a beer for everyone here.  The new black IPA is absolutely incredible, as well as the Mandarin wheat. I am excited for the double IPA sour to make it's return.   So far I haven't ordered anything I don't like.  The prime rib sliders are ridiculous, which makes it tough to order anything else.  My wife loves the wings grilled and retossed.  The pb & j burger is incredible as well, and goes great with the peanut butter cup Porter.   My kids are treated very well by all the staff.  My youngest loves to sit at the dog bone outside and have the fire turned on, which they never hesitate to do for him.  I will continue to frequent this amazing establishment almost every Saturday.  Thank you Uncle Bear's for making the weekends great for our family.

8Jt1TE8spWNe4gJu-OsJQA.text: The atmosphere is friendly and the food is delicious.  The Brisket Herd's burger they are running on their summer menu is to die for!!!!   Great beer selection and great food.  Definitely recommend this place if your in Ahwatukee!

aRN8Ij3orGVJOEyjhwDNaA.text: This dog-friendly bar has a great happy hour menu! Staff is all very friendly! Great place to sit back, watch sports and enjoy a beer :) Easily the best dog-friendly restaurant in Ahwatukee!

HNBYQ3GIUbd2gjb9tnqB1g.text: They have Green Flash IPA on tap!  The food is good, wait staff are friendly and knowledgeable.

lVkOFlyZ2x0HTKz_MiOMhw.text: Loving this place - great neighborhood bar and grill.  My husband and I have been 3 times in the last couple weeks, and have had consistent and great service, food, and atmosphere!  Can't say we have a single complaint.

YYmosrYhCq7wuzt7X9zsbQ.text: First time in.. Diane was so nice and made a very warm welcome.. The house brew is awesome I had the head to tale amber ale and can't complain.. Diane was very constant and very attentive.. I've found a new spot for a drink..

r1sY_2qYN8aEMLwKTPPw-A.text: Four of us dined there before the movies. Excellent service, really good food, nice comfortable atmosphere, good vibe, good beer, lots of tv's, not too loud. I wish the movie was as good as Uncle Bears'! Yes, we'll be back.

j0k0xxkkx-ArIsHHx3HweQ.text: Stopped by for lunch while working. Good food but I didn't get to try any beer! One major complaint: no free wifi!

zsyfa3-RQeumdGA0I-optA.text: Takes for EVER to get your food. We come here a lot because we like the wings, but we must say it takes at least  45 min to get wings. They need to improve the service.

NICLsE_WWxfrkC1VIAv_xw.text: Love it here. Excellent atmosphere and drink selections. Food is good and the staff is friendly. I certainly recommend. Tons of TV's as well. Lets support our local establishments!

MKyfdcVlO4GRM_mFzR4sMQ.text: I've been here a few times, and I never leave disappointed. Beer is always on point, waiters are awesome, but the mango double grilled and double tossed wings always makes me come back!

6CeV5qwzoUbwR_XvO7jYLg.text: I stopped in for an IPA at the Ahwatukee location. What they served me was no IPA, it tasted more like some kind of berry beer. I had the bartender sample it and he said without looking me in the eye that it was absolutely an IPA and I should be able to tell by the hoppiness. I explained that I am from Portland (where IPAs reign supreme) and that the beer they are calling an IPA tastes like no IPA I have ever had. The bartender dug his heels in and did not offer another selection. I settled my tab and left. I went to Tukee's to get a proper IPA (Racer) and sat by a former employee who told me that they had changed brewers and their IPA recipe as well. He agreed that what they are putting forth as IPA is a joke and is but one reason why they are doing so poorly. Sad because I really wanted this location to work out.

r7755GbxGMkdW5YjTweVHw.text: Cool ambiance and nice wait staff. Three stars because expectations exceeded the taste of the food since prices are a little higher and decor a little trendier than your local bar scene. I got the prime rib sliders but they lacked any flavor development and sides were all about average. However, I think risking another visit to try a different item on the menu is worth it just to have their wings again.

bdxH5k0erGosGBgh89c2Jg.text: Really good beers, and the hamburgers are outstanding.  Prime Rib sliders were really good but could've used a little more jus for dipping.   Best for last:  The Cheddar Ale soup is totally bonkers!  I've never had anything like it.  Service was attentive, helpful with the menu and beer selection, and pretty quick.   The place has a sports-bar atmosphere with a zillion TV's and a rambunctious crowd, but nothing I'd be afraid to bring the children to.

RaqJA-v5fd_GFumPkHka1Q.text: Let me start off by saying that I did have a bad experience but they did step up and recover. My food order got lost after a lengthy wait I asked what was going on only to learn of the error. The bartenders stepped up and provided me with a comp to help the situation which was very much appreciated. It's nice to see places take ownership for their mistakes and not just leave the customer to absorb it.  I had the bbq pork sliders which were great. I found the food prices to be $2-3 more than surrounding sports bars for basic apps and burgers. Their other items were more priced like you were in a restaurant for but getting bar food. As such if you're looking for value you might not find it here, I didn't notice any specials either. One thing that does stand out is their homemade beers, they've got the market cornered in this area for sure. They also have an outdoor patio area and open window bar area which is good when the temps are nice outside.  I'll be back when I'm in the mood for a crafted beer. But for value CK's and Native I find to be better.

dL_rzC2zp-Ngjjq5ySzeaQ.text: The Mandarin beer was pretty good. The food was alright. The bacon cheese fries were good. I felt the prime rib sliders were sub par quality, but i wasn't sure what i was buying so it could be the standard for prime rib sliders.

YOAoMyKd1hGEBoM9OOfkzw.text: AMAZING! I was supposed to meet a friend here once and decided to go elsewhere because of the negative reviews. Great good, beer, and service! Kids had Mac and cheese. We had the pretzel, prime rib sliders, and grilled cheese with garlic fries. Everything was extraordinarily good!!

kQJER4sKZHa6ECi-WYLRsg.text: I love this place. I can either come here with a group of friends or my daughter and family.  I really recommend their tc sliders with cheddar cheese and parm garlic fries!

GjE6l2JrDZqUdGioFyTwdw.text: I have visited this place several times with my family, and by myself.  Good IPA beer.  My wife liked the prime rib she ate.  The New Mexico burger is always a great choice.  I would recommend this place to anyone.  Great for kids because of the noise level over rides my kids.

1bq-IKzcAmwWNu7_LLTPcg.text: My husband and II stopped in for a beer and some wings last night and were seated in the bar.  It happened again, we are at a brewery and they are out of three of the drafts listed that we asked for!  We were so disappointed and wanted to leave but reluctantly ordered the Mandarin Wheat Beer since they actually had it, and then we knew why; it was just awful, a few sips and we were done!  The wings were good and the server was just OK, not enough waiters.  Last time we went was about six months ago on a Friday and we were seated on the patio, which was fine.  Evidently we were invisible because we sat for 20 minutes and were never spoken to, no menus, no water, nothing!  All I can say is lesson learned, we will never go again.  We support our local businesses and unless they seriously change their ways and hire good help that are trained they will be closing their doors!

bP6hV1TcUIjjT76vZBg-Vw.text: The food is less than mediocre both times I have been there. Turkey sandwich on plain white bread not even toasted, dry (if there was mayo it was non existent, with some lettuce and tomato. The pizza tasted like a frozen concoction, and wilty Cesar salad with nothing but some dried bacon (I think) crumbles. The beer cheese soup's flavor is ok but so thick and gelatinous you can't eat much. Have a beer, avoid the food.

1R230Hvt2WzsnKYvQ7b_Aw.text: It's Saturday... You got lots of Tvs and im stuck listening to Cyndi Lauper. Are you a bar or a gay night club. Turn on the volume of the game dammit!

RAyW7jGLphdqG6JTnNak3g.text: The Mandarin Wheat is exceptional; it is the reason we wanted to try this little spot to begin with. We ordered a flight, beers were all decent. Not bad, but not particularly special. We also ordered food.  Same as beer: not bad, not crave-able. Happy hour prices are reasonable and service was attentive.

W-Hi6EV_j41WNrgiHwgAiQ.text: Came here recently with my family. While I didn't understand the atmosphere with dogs upon entering, I soon learned the history from reading their menu. While the food was good, it was a bit odd seeing photos of puppies next to meat options.   Staff was friendly and attentive to their tables.  Will likely visit again though!

UXjvi_aa_WdIHFbIZKWxvQ.text: Uncle Bear's is awesome! We wanted to go somewhere last Sunday 4/16/17 to grab a few beers and watch the NBA playoffs, but to also bring the dogs without feeling like they're a nuisance. Uncle Bear's was the PERFECT solution. We sat at the outside bar which had plenty of room and 3 TVs to catch the games on. If you're not a bar person, there were plenty of high top and low top outdoor tables as well. Our bartender, Derek was great with recommendations and was fun to hang out with for the time that we were there.   It took me FOREVER to order my food because everything on the menu looked so good. I ended up getting the grilled cheese which was amazing. I thought it would be too overboard with the menu description, but I just had to try it anyways. Much to my surprise it wasn't too much, it was just right and perfectly balanced with the bacon and basil. I can't speak to the bisque because that's not my thing and I didn't try it, but I'm sure if you're into that combo it only escalates the experience. My boyfriend got the sliders which he loved! We were surprised by the portion size... 4 sliders instead of the normal 3 you get other places. He raved about the hawaiian role like buns they came on. Also beer battered fries... need I say more.  TLDR: Excellent food. Great Beer. Awesome Service. 5 star Patio. Perfect for dogs.

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Bear's Grill & Tap - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Grilled Cheese: Grilled Texas Toast, Mozzarella, Jack, American, Irish Cheddar, Bacon, Basil and Cheese Sauce.

NKeHVUnlj4OZdFLuNZtCzA.text: We're beer snobs but I'm sampling away and the beers. Nice staff and clean teaching the bartender about California beer!!!     We did try most of them. I'd have to say the ipa if I was... The madriarn  wasn't how I expect it, it was more of a tangy sour beer to me. I could taste the bitterness in it, However I enjoyed  your location and staff!

5LLC2JbSCWD-R9uUPVfSiw.text: Out of town looking for beer and food. Uncle Bear's fits the bill. Not too crowded, happy hour until 7. Got the pulled pork sliders, comes with 4 which is plenty of food. Ocean Beach West Coast IPA and get the Debo's Kettle Sour DIPA while it's in season. Talk to Larry at the bar he knows his stuff

9GH1VItEHbG8ETokz8rm8Q.text: I love supporting this local brewery. Yummy craft beers served by the wonderful Alexis. This place has some great jalapeno poppers with some spicy jelly. The peanut butter jelly burger gives my palette a real treat.  I love this doggie friendly restaurant.

alMqkt1qwpd5LA_7BwSSsw.text: This is one of my favorite places around. Great beer, tasty Mozerella sticks and cool staff. If you get a chance to meet a bartender named Larry, you'll be stoked! Great dude. Also, the dog friendly environment is so fun. Enjoy!  Also, the wings are so good!

AiCaZT5w6oV-W4VF9LaWzA.text: I really liked the physical space at this brewpub. Very open, somewhat industrial, plenty of tv's. Service was good also, but the food was pretty mediocre. We ordered a pizza and the chips with queso, quac, and salsa. Both were very unremarkable, especially the pizza. I've had better frozen pies from the grocery store.

wkD7pDoroSapetJLidlFcQ.text: Full disclosure: I'm from San Diego which is one of the best beer cities. Beers were okay at best. Food was awful. The pulled pork sliders were over sauced and under portioned. Beer battered fries are lightly battered, not bad. Ranch is water thin and lacking any credibility.  The atmosphere is inviting but more bar than brewery. Plenty of opportunity to improve and I'd try again if they get a decent head brewer

rKixdd-KKV4oVxaPwc1wKA.text: Waitress was very honest about menu which was refreshing. Nice beer selection, really liked the ocean beach ipa. Service a bit slow but food  tasted good

By-2Gac4um4TreD87oyEDg.text: A fantastic brewery in this part of town with great food. I have been here a bunch of times and here is the mini rundown. The herds burger is awesome. I usually add a egg to it. The other sandwiches are all good but the herds stands out for me. The prime rib sliders are a best seller and are fantastic. TheGet a side of creamed and raw horseradish. I love the sweet potato fries as a side. Fish tacos are also a good idea.   The beer is great. They have seasonal beers on tap which are always fun. The regular beers are good. IPA and double IPA go down nice.

cqOyud10gnvN146UQUZlFA.text: Both times I've come in the food and servers have been great! I don't know what is in the sauce they put on their grilled cheese but it is phenomenal! I want to try other things on their menu but the grilled cheese is just too good not to order!   Also love that the cookie dessert comes in a dog bowl. Super cute touch!

VG4FKaxnOBST8agh_MM6pg.text: Beer is fantastic and the prices are awesome too! Love the Asian chicken salad, wings and chips and salsa.   James is a cutie and was super helpful with beer selections and wing sauces.   Great experience!

hXt_cYP3L59uTGSUb-j9RQ.text: Great local place here watching football lots of energy lots of good beer and the food is amazing I've been here about five times now and I have never been disappointed I love the burgers and the staff is super friendly and this place is always packed

1ANY5n3owHVsuJxCbdrffg.text: Great food and service! Garlic fries were soo delicious. Highly recommend place to visit. They also have a very large variety of beer. House beer was amazing

8JGzjQ8V2tieKHrCi1hQoA.text: Extremely bad service. We (like all the following tables) respected the "Wait to be seated" sign. However it is after a certain while, when a server notices you that someone comes eventually to seat you. The drinks took a very long time to arrive to our table and the food much much longer! We did notice dishes waiting under the "hot" lamps, but our server didn't go and pick them up... The food arrived and three out of four dishes were not enjoyable, certainly not good enough to forgive the bad service

xcqMcH00MUOo5sK7y_tb3w.text: A place to bring my four legged friend! The unique dog themed decor was something I seriously loved. From the bone shaped tables, to the pictures of furry companions, there was something about this place that felt very homey.  I could keep raving about the decor, but they also brew up some bitchin' beer! Of course I had to try and lick up all the different ones so I ordered a flight. You get to choose up to five different breeds, but the Peanut Butter Cup Porter made me tear off my muzzle! It honestly tasted like liquid Reese's Pieces and would have even made Pavlov drool.  The beer here comes highly recommended, but don't forget to bring your ankle biters!

xYknuCuMqbWfKznLkV6Tjw.text: We came on a Saturday evening and the place was at 35-40% capacity. The menus were dirty as were a few of the tables that had nothing on them despite having enough staff to keep both clean. Food took inordinately long and was just OK. Limited wine selection. Wasn't a fan of the Amber Ale. I won't come back and wouldn't recommend.

Zxe8QrLzIk7jjCX5Ip1EwA.text: Uncle Bears has a nice selection of unique brewed on premises beer options.  Many are quite good. It's fun to come here and explore the seasonal offerings. Food is good. Well prepared and plated.  The value is acceptable for the serving size, quality and taste. While not a national chain and with only a few local locations, Uncle Bears is a highly polished operation.  I like to linger, enjoy some libations and eventually order. Our waitperson, Levi, identified that allowing us the space to enjoy our visit while also checking in frequently. Bravo for that level of service.   Additionally, Uncle Bears gives back to the community.  So give back and check them out.

Cvzlp4p5EPPQAh3WCHrFJg.text: Sat down ordered drinks and then server disappeared. Been over 15 mins and he's still gone. Service horrible in keeping us waiting. Another table sat after us and he takes their order while we still waiting. (Real time) hope he shows up soon. Tip is pretty much gone now.

-Ee4yMaMmyL76YnWPw6RVQ.text: Lots of TVs around the restaurant. We shared a flatbread and the pulled pork sandwich and both were good. The brews were okay (barktoberfest and another dark beer) for $4.50 each.

1X9Bq3pKy5a9bu9sWgWFwA.text: I'm pretty sure my family just found their new favorite bar and grill. My husband and I ate here for the first time, aside from it taking a little bit for someone to notice we were standing at the front to be seated we loved this place. The waiter Jesse was super nice and the food was awesome, we got the garlic parm fries, chips and salsa ... The fries were amazing. The tostada nachos , hot wings, cheese steak sandwich.. Were all delicious. We will def be back!

jz3e3JO3vbD4_lPN4vSCTA.text: We stopped by here to kill some time and grab a drink before our movie next door. My girl had been there before but I hadn't, and we both loved it. The ambiance is very comfortable, they have a back area that's heated by little fires on the table and the drinks were well done. They craft their own beer and offer samples for those who want to taste before hand. This place is also dog friendly in case you want to bring Fido along with you. Overall I would recommend this place to anyone looking for good craft beer (didn't eat there, so not sure).

HrBtB_HfA_89C6eT8w5_aw.text: Food is great beer is great service is poor. I had a large table 8-9 people. Waited for all services.  Never came by to check on us. Bartender never asked us. Went w/o food beer for 15-20 mins. Often forgot to bring us beer. Asked a 2nd time. Server got better. Still poor. Queen Creek UB'S rocks. They know customer service.

8Re-ylNiWmn7NZdM_FEG4g.text: A great selection of unique and tasty beers. Good menu and ample portions!

E-vxa9OShEoyKlYXMt0h1A.text: Wasn't impressed at all. My husband and I went in on a Saturday night and they were out of half the beers that they advertised as being on special. The cocktails were weak and boring. No plans to return.

20BAQm3FgSYPxhpRpQWNIA.text: You're not going to find a better $10 cheeseburger in the area. The thing is massive, too.  We probably should have just shared one and still would have been stuffed.  Great grilled wings, nice spice and flavor.  Matt (manager) was very helpful and friendly.

gR59ovSYa8ydPBxpQwxt3w.text: Great place to hang out at the bar.  Excellent service, good food, friendly people and an awesome Pomegranite Long Island!

aeLzfcP14JswG4_Yf5Xrag.text: We came here as a group of 11. Usually large group = poor service.  Not at this place! Francis, the manager had our outdoor table ready upon our arrival, just as promised.  He had the most patient server assigned to our table of three children and eight adults.  Seven appetizers, five beer flights, children's orders, various other drinks, and six entrees later, there was only one small mistake.  Service was attentive, curtious, and appreciated.  Cant wait to go back with just the wife and kids.

gyjacU38qLyoKmCoJTP3-w.text: WOW!  Just tested four yummy items: the grilled cheese, garlic parm fries, wedge salad and the TOMATO BISQUE which deserves to be in capital letters.  This soup is definitely something I will put on my "foods and movies I want to enjoy when I'm in hospice" list....and that is not! a downer comment....that is a list of honor!

4HFoLtEAz7ypa-5gCpQ3XA.text: Great place to sit down with friends and grab drinks. The food is also good. Not the typical "bar" food which is nice. The blackened chicken salad is usually what I get with the sesame ginger dressing. If you have a dog you can bring them and sit on the patio which is nice. Inside there are a lot of TVs which usually have some type of sporting event on.

AvLcG9XZG1qBnEYNr4KD3A.text: Service is friendly...that being said. I have been sitting here 45 mins waiting on our order for 3 people and a child. Sad day.

0omxfcAzrB2Wcm79HhUxWg.text: Well, i had the chicken sliders, and the helpings were plenty (4), along with delicios fries to go along with a jump beer. Perfect combo.  Also ordered the artichoke and spinach queso app, but itbwas queso with some spinach, and I am still looking for artichoke.  Not good when it cost $9.50

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Bear's Grill & Tap - Phoenix, AZ, United States

U8Ao2CA31zOlpd9_cCtV1w.text: Last night was my second time here. The service was bad. Started off good, but things progressively got worse. Our food took forever to come out but we saw it sitting on the line. I would have asked where the food was but we could not find our server. Eventually a different server came over and said that someone made a mistake with one of the sandwiches and that's why the food took so long. (Why everyone at our table had to wait over one sandwich, I don't know). Once the food came out it was pretty bad. The buns on the sliders were hard, the fries were cold and soggy, my pizza was missing ingredients. I got the Hunters which called for arugula and balsamic which it had neither. Prob won't be coming back any time soon if at all. Just overall weird bad service this time around.

P8Z0_1tnsAI94kOOydHQog.text: This is a decent place for a quick stop for American burgers and fries . Beer was ok nothing great. There are a lot of other places you can try out instead of this . Food is not bad but I was not happy with the service as we had to remind our waiter to get our second order several times and he almost forgot to bring the cheque at the end :(

9KvwixPK49GwIvT71uWDyg.text: My son and I finally decided to give this place a try. The food was good, I had the pulled pork sandwich with beer battered sweet patatoe fries on a brioche bun, and my son tried the New Mexico green chilli burger on a pretzel bun. Not too hot as you would expect from a New Mexico green chilli burger. I tied the Mandarin wheat, It was decent, Nothing compared to Four Peaks Hefe or Blue Moon either. If I could rate 3.5 I would.  The food was good though. Proper portion sizes also.

k9jMdnhVU5sZye0nay8JRA.text: We stopped here last weekend for lunch as we were out doing errands. It is a great location (near a lot of shopping) and the atmosphere is wonderful. I love the look of the brewery and restaurant, they did a great job! The visit started out well, we were greeted and seated and saw our waiter quickly. After that, it just got worse and worse. It took forever before our waiter came and took our food order and it took longer and longer to see him each time. He seemed to forget about my husband's first beer and by the time he had remembered, the head on the beer had completely gone down and we saw him over at the bar take a straw and stir it up to make it look like it was freshly poured. The food also took over 40 minutes to come out, not sure if that was the kitchen or waiter's fault. The food was very good though as is their beer. We will definitely give this place another shot and hopefully get better service!

yMdtO1_ywJ9k2q60BEPjIw.text: Great food and even better beer. Very nice and knowledgeable brewer and lots of variety on tap. Atmosphere is nothing to write home about but my overall experience was great.

QQ-noF5De1-1GkXDMTf6lA.text: Great beer and food. Bar service is always excellent and the layout is great - lots of flat screens and the patio is nice as well.  Patio is dog friendly too which is cool.  Check it out if you are in Ahwatukee.

lFiE1KI1Z0tmzVn9_1lcXg.text: This sports bar needs to be reviewed on two separate things. The bar itself, the tvs, the setup and the staff are amazing. I have never seen a place with this many televisions and no matter where you sit you can see at least 5 tvs. Every bar should be set up this way because for watching football it can't be beat. Now, the food on the other hand could use improvement. Some burgers I have had were overcooked, same with chicken, soup has been so thick its like a dip and I've seen more then a few of my friends not.finish all their food and that's odd for them. The menu has decent variety but nothing special. I have never had the pizza but I have heard from others it is not worth it. It's just too bad the food can't be better because everything else about the place rocks.

sr-WIEuJWReO_BrJ1Kf4hw.text: Our waiter was super nice. I've been here a handful of times and this is the first that we've had such a good waiter. I ordered the lemon thyme dish-a bit salty. The old Ball and chain had the wings , I ended up eating some of his food. The beer is always good and they had live music today, not to shabby for a quick dinner

lp0z-MnJal5JCb3GYKrw2g.text: Our male server was great to start and very helpful. Even offered a free dessert for a birthday we were celebrating. However, as our time progressed, he rarely came to check in. The restaurant was empty! We finally waited for a long long time to get our bill, and finally, my mother stood up and waved "yoo-hoo" in a joking manner. He looked up at her, and looked back down. Didn't even smile. Did not even care about her! I was so angered by his terrible service and rudeness to our family. And of course he did not even bring a dessert as promised. Good food, but I will likely not ever be back due to the awkward and rude service.

FU-Skoakg_YHZ60fV24vgA.text: First - The beer is not cold. I sat at the bar and watched 2 bartenders work their butts off to a packed house. Most people including myself waited at least 15 minutes or more to be served. They were taking care of the bar consumers and the people seated at tables. They needed at least 3 more people behind the bar. They forgot about our food order. After 45 minutes I asked about when our food would be coming and admitted they forgot. When I finally got it, it was cold. Could be a great place but they need more help.

1jii66i6N5ts-TpMyUYMeg.text: First off, the service was excellent. Jordan our server was excellent as she was prompt and very friendly and accommodating.  I had the Uncle Bear's peanut butter cup,  very good.  Another person in my party had an IPA, Mutts Nutts, he said it was pretty good.  Another party had the dark ale and thought it was OK. Another person in my  party had the Mandarin wheat and thought it was favorable.

JZhEa7h2hR79am14b3uFcQ.text: This place was great. We don't get to go out to dinner often because of a young child so when we do we have high expectations. This place totally hit the mark. The staff was so attentive, and I feel this is a rarity that the dining experience is lacking these days. The food was great and the beer was good. Fun ambiance but again the staff we had was so good. I would recommend this place to anyone and it is family friendly.  The beer cheese soup was sooo good!!!!

sqjbHQtpYyKwCXHDgb6T1g.text: Food sucks!!! Need to lower the A/C, feels like a 100 degrees inside. Beer is a three star. Don't waste ur money.

47KRf-aJBYz7LGa2dE5z-A.text: The burgers are outstanding! Can't wait to go back and try the wings and the pizza! It's a brew house! So they have all the fun stuff on site for that and the brew dude is really friendly and will answer any of your questions! The beer isn't too bad! Great place to chill and watch a game!

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Bear's Grill & Tap - Phoenix, AZ, United States

7VZe10SmqVlwX5Lq7jutTw.text: Good was ok! I had a beer my girlfriend suggested that was pretty good kinda fruity girlie but warm! Had wings and fries something I never order but I made it a cheat day! Not likely to return!

exrEqdOHEaOjftVRjlZb-Q.text: Great appetizers and beer. I had a beer with a hit of mandarin orange which was amazing! For apps Nachos, cheese fries with tenders tossed in wing sauce, pulled pork sliders, and mac&cheese all of which hit the spot. Staff was very pleasant, especially the bartender Christine. Overall excellent experience with great beer.

rp8_tNpUlMGiH2R-YJOj7g.text: Wings were very good. Burger was just ok. Beer has greatly improved since they opened.   Patio and bar area is very comfortable and nice if weather is good.

_za5nyIsl_CdHHEkCyfJ6A.text: Best Brew Was The "Gold" it lives up to its Name ..! I enjoyed the Stout Also they had me feeling Some Type Of Way ..!

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Bear's Grill & Tap - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Take A Trip Back In Time at The Wall Of Old Beer Cans
Photo of Uncle Bear's Grill & Tap - Phoenix, AZ, United States. I Love GOLD ...!

77nlpQZCgU4SyuQlZm5spA.text: Amazing ambience, delicious beer, tasty food and a dog-friendly patio... what else do you need? We will definitely be back when our travels bring us to Phoenix. Staff was very helpful and engaging. The location is perfect for both locals and people traveling on I-10. Can't wait to stop by soon!

fG26bH8hCCXmkRylbeD8EQ.text: Nice to have a local brewhouse. Wish servers were more informed as to specials, Happy Hour foods, and info on actual restaurant. A plus was the veggie/goat cheese pizza. If you request gluten-free, they'll totally accommodate.

Gxfy78ryPc4eMggXL4RIrg.text: I came here on a Sunday night after a rough day.  It was great sitting by the bar with 2 fireplaces going.  Nice atmosphere.  Alexis, our bartender was great and nice to talk to.   She let me try the dark ale and porter,which were really good.  Why only four stars?  because the "west coast" IPA they brew was anything but.  I didnt think is was good.  my next beer, I switched to a real west coast IPA,Sculpin.  But again, those dark beers I tasted were good.

NRqHW2Rf9klYS7Q7JxmaMA.text: Went to Uncle Bears post movie to stuff a giant delicious garlic pretzel in my face. This action was achieved and my server was very nice and prompt. What got the lowered stars was the karaoke. I understand alcohol and singing go hand in hand, but this is a large establishment and there is no reason to have the mic turned up to defcon 4. I was sitting wayyyyyy in the back by the lovely display of antique beer cans and the man singing actually vibrated my table.  My date looked at me and said "we need to leave now, right now." And we did. I hope to return soon as the pretzels are truly amazing.

g_PTyY6qmVDx5gHAivWDWQ.text: The Peanut Butter Cup Porter is fantastic!  Have eaten here a few times and always a very good experience!   Menu has a wide selection, and always a variety of good beer choices.  Absolutely a good choice!

Y0sEzBv6B0kRYQLCmnw-TQ.text: We went friday night and there was a prime rib special. Great price, crispy and fresh salad, awesome sweet potato fries, but the steak was barely warm. Service was friendly, so we went back today for lunch to try again. We ordered their beef sliders. They were very good, and on special on mondays! Still loved their sweet potato fries!! We want to go back for pizza. We also want to bring our dogs and sit on the patio!

tDhrmGZO2qkEQZo6SA7lbA.text: Good food, casual atmosphere, and a decent beer selection.  Can't comment on the beer too much since everyone has their preference, but I found a couple selections I liked.  The food was good.  Wasn't exceptional, just standard issue bar food.  I'll probably be back to tray some other things on the menu.  There's probably some story behind it but I thought it was odd that they have a Mobil Oil red pegasus logo hanging on their back wall.

EkK8LQB0OFU7ioavc8PbSg.text: Great food. Had the opportunity to try their beer cheese soup which was great mixture of cheese and bacon. Also tried their Cajun sandwich which had a perfect kick. If your looking for an app their pretzel  with cheese is amazing. Great view of the brewery as well if your interested in see how their brews are made.

8t9CfxYCqxJqdNv3rzVlug.text: Love this place. The first time I came it took a minute for a server to great my hubby and I in the bar area but after that inital hicup everything else has been fantastic every time I come! Bar staff is always on point and lots of TVs!

Na1hL5FNbp1k-RJKK-C_GQ.text: I love coming here with my dog and girlfriend. It's a great place to take your fur baby!

9G8CyaXrl4MD5ALrswZ_HQ.text: This is the okay-est place I know. (Minus the wings, my husband hated them).   I got the Asian salad and loved it. It was really, really good.   My husband HATED the wings. I don't think he's ever not finished all 12 wings since I've known him. When I asked what the problem was he goes "just not good, something weird about them".   The server was average, not attentive but brought us our food and beer in timely manner.   Beers were ok, nothing to write home about.   So, food was ok, beers were ok, service was not stellar. There you have it, folks!

XzEGyJ4oH82bMznN2N4eeg.text: Cool place, atmosphere is pleasing in a brewery pub style.  Food was ok. Server suggested the wings "grilled and retossed" style and said "they're the best". They tasted good but I prefer traditional hot wings. Honey hot was tasty, but again the grilled style kind of made them burned. I had the HERDs brisket burger and it sounds good on paper with all the ingredients, but they didn't work well enough together. The biggest knock against this place has to be that the menus, tables and even salt and pepper shakers were sticky and dirty.  Overall, the food was ok, not overly delicious but decent. The service was pretty good, especially since the server didn't get the reaction she was hoping for on the wings and took them off the bill since she suggested it. Which was a very classy move.   Queso and chips were good. I would give it another chance but wouldn't highly recommend   Elisa was very nice though!

pjq4bkhHQCK5k3GxqQrZ3Q.text: My family and I go to Uncle Bear's whenever we want a burger.  We like them Medium Rare and this is one of the few places you actually get medium rare rather than medium... or worse.  All the food is WAY above bar food.  This is a serious restaurant that also happens to have good beer and TV's.  Service is always journeyman work and the atmosphere is very nice, not nearly as noisy as most places.  Not that it isn't lively, I assume it may be the high ceilings or some sound deadening construction.

goF4NnLlMOvof2PLSiZGpQ.text: Loved it! Came on a Friday morning and my pup and I sat at the patio. The server brought her a bowl of water. Aww. That was cool. The mists and shade honestly made it cool in there so my pup surprisingly wasn't panting the whole time! I had the mandarin uncle brew beer (it's the second in the beer list) that was delicious, and I'm not a big beer person! Had the uncle bear burger. Yum. The fries were sooo gooooood! I would come back just for fries and beer lol. Lucy and I will return again

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Bear's Grill & Tap - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lunch special burger
Photo of Uncle Bear's Grill & Tap - Phoenix, AZ, United States. House beer. Yum!
Photo of Uncle Bear's Grill & Tap - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Water for Lucy.

q1naxnUoEuw9FIThrVwMCQ.text: This place has really lost its flare lately. Food prices are very high. One person can easily spend $30 for a meal and a drink. It's usually empty even on Saturdays which is too bad considering the outside bar and game room.  Nice spot, nice area but food is expensive but ok. Not sure what they are doing wrong. But somethings got to change or closing will be in their future.   The rent has got to be astronomical here and I'm sure it's tough to pay with little to no customers.

529WgxNB2cuovSRa7Z9XeQ.text: Had to check this place out for their beer.. their food wasn't bad.. we ordered the green chilie burger and prime rib sliders. Along with the peanut butter porter ale (pretty good)... the burger was a lil too greasy but overall pretty good and I will be back to try all the other beers they make and try some of their wings

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Bear's Grill & Tap - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Uncle Bear's Grill & Tap - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Uncle Bear's Grill & Tap - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Peanut butter porter

55_Irb_77g8AJtyf0mh7yQ.text: Came in last night for my first time ever with my mom I was very impressed The atmosphere was fun and exciting and my mom always gets nervous going outfor happy hour because she thinks she won't fit in and she is to old but the place was great people of all ages and everyone seemed be laughing and really enjoying themselves. We ordered the steak fries with bacon for a starter and it was HUGE and DELICIOUS. We will definitely be back again especially for the happy hour I recommend trying the wings

16QunITb8UfGSzPW0AZECA.text: Food was good.  Service was bad and the beers were not cold.  The beers weren't warm, but not as cold as beer is normally served.  We wondered if they put cold beer in warm glasses.  We had 3 different beers.

tZJI9LrYjxb-0fM5JoSYaQ.text: I like this microbrewery mostly for their Irish Red ale.  The fare is good too.  The wings are great, haven't regretted one yet.  Also like the lemon chicken, prime rib sliders and pork sliders.  The atmosphere is open and pleasant as are the staff.  Prefer the place during slower hours.  So if you go please go when it's busy

GU0QhFNTMWxtcgM8cjB47w.text: Good beer. Much better on tap than in a can but isn't that typical? I'm not a fan of their canned beers.  The food is typical bar food but on the good side of things.  The staff is pleasant and kept on top of our beer levels and kept us drinking Thank you!

UeAlwvHKiHP6ACiyyurarQ.text: Food was ok.  Dog friendly a plus.  We have been here multiple time with good experiences. Tonight was a disappointment.   Service was inexcusable. Not very busy and we waited 20 min for drinks.  Had to hunt down server for food    Nope.  To many good places to waste our time.  Very disappointed.  Not many cool digs in Ahwatukee     This is now off our list.  :(

jvn2GWtpDxMBxxafHsVO4Q.text: Ok, the beer here is not mind blowing by any stretch, but to say it's horrible or disgusting is a far cry from the truth as well! BTW Yelpers if you're going to trash beer here or anywhere else please say why you didn't like it! Saying it's disgusting and leaving it at that just shows your lack of credibility IMHO! Again is the beer here mind blowing, no, is it well made, clean and free of off flavors yes it is! So though it may not be the latest trend in yuppified Organic Beer, it is a nice stop in for a decent Beer in a decent atmosphere! Can some of these brews be improved upon? Yes they can, but they are not disgusting either! As a brewer I found them adequate and as I said well made! Clean and without flaws! Did not eat here so cannot comment on the food! Service was fine!

JH0RdUtALfBJg4iXTINRvg.text: I had ordered from a delivery service from here once and was impressed. I remember amazing fresh made croutons and fresh shredded cheese on a salad. I decided to go in finally. Besides the obvious appeal for all the non-monsters out there - DOGS!!!, the experience deserved five stars  My bartenders were friendly and told me their names (I forgot cause I'm the worst) 9/8. Bar service was SUPER attentive and the food was great. I was super happy with their brews. I had the Barktoberfest :).   I also bartend and have served tables for over ten years. I don't usually expect much when i go out, but this place is perfect for building regulars.   I'll be back!

ZEwAtNT6nZgGFmlRg07CoA.text: Great atmosphere. Dog friendly patio seating. Food was Great. Our boys had a cheese pizza they really liked; myself I had the classic sliders with beer battered fries, Delish; hubby had the Brisket Herds burger and devoured it.  Flight sample available for their beers on tap.

B4SEOQ2iRWFs9ulSQM_mBA.text: Stopped in after a movie and had Thomas as my server. He recommended the back yard punch and I'm hooked. Awesome server, very fun to talk to. Will come back next week for sure.

-I2Tpfvf35tJ88zvcTofzg.text: The Pulled Pork sliders were delicious! I suggest adding the onion strings for extra yumminess. The garlic Parmesan fries were excellent. The atmosphere was nice and our server, Amanda, was very friendly. We went on a Saturday afternoon and it wasn't too busy, which surprised me after tasting my food. They had plenty of TVs, inside and out, to watch the NFL wildcard games. Outdoors had a nice fire pit to enjoy the cool weather and sunny day.  My husband had the guacamole chicken sandwich and didn't love his food as much. Especially after he tasted mine.

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Bear's Grill & Tap - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Garlic Parmesan fries
Photo of Uncle Bear's Grill & Tap - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pulled pork sliders

_7jFWezUkvFVxzOL4Fr2uw.text: Great place to unwind after a long day. Larry has been the serving my dranks for as long as I been coming here. Place is dog friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Bear's Grill & Tap - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great place to unwind after a long day. ILarry has been the serving my dranks for as long as I been coming here. Place is dog friendly.

NtL9uOSoWZOZtTjnPVZwOw.text: Great tasting appetizers, reasonably priced, amazing beer selection, dog friendly, and A1 service. Will definitely be coming back, highly recommend.

jQwJfNv1j9p3KdzMvABZQg.text: I'm definitely a fan of Uncle Bear's Brewery.  Their staff is friendly and beers are always good - plus, the patio is dog friendly which keeps us coming back.  The food is good, but you should go into it knowing what to expect which is bar-type cuisine; definitely not what you'd get at a newer gastropub type of craft brewery (I think if you go into it knowing that, you won't be disappointed).

qbdtfGO85YaYnh3wm91ipQ.text: I come here for lunch a couple times a week. It's always a great experience. They have great gluten free options, the staff is friendly and professional, and the service is always great. Love this place!!

5uhljkqdgJSxkLh_A0hk-w.text: Pleasantly surprised! We stopped in, totally hangry just hoping for adequate food and wow! Excellent chicken fingers and fries. Will be craving those at a future date. Good blackened chicken salad too. Marg was good and lots of sports on the tvs. We will be back. :-)

74ZNhUVcB2kd9CCew1nRZg.text: Food came out 15 minutes apart. Half the table was done with their food before the rest came. The waitress has been gone for 30 minutes. Waiting on drink refills. Two orders came out wrong and we asked for the sides to fix it. They haven't been back to fix anything. If this was the first time it wasn't good, maybe we consider it a fluke. Third time this has happened out of the last six we've been here...Yea, not coming back.

j5dsbSlUIBvIfunU5Bpz-A.text: Only go here during happy hour. Otherwise, the sticker shock is massive for a place that only serves its own beer, which is often questionable. Service is good, and you can take your dog. Except lots of bad owners bring their dogs too.

XiyVS2KYyjgD7jEmTAvb4g.text: This is a very interesting but fun themed-brewery. As you may guess from the logo, it's all dog-themed which is funny but not over-done so it's great. Since it was our first time here, me and my girlfriend ordered a flight or beer samplers which came on a big wooden dog bone shaped plank, again awesome. Honestly, their beers didn't blow our mind, the seasonal Pale Ale was surprisingly bitter and the Golden Ale was a bit bland. However, I really liked the Dark Ale and Hefe. The food seemed pretty pricey so we stuck with pretzels which were terrific.

Nwh4hiu9KpCVxGpb62sHjw.text: This is place is awesome, hands down great food and craft beer. not to mention a dog friendly restaurant for you animal lovers. Everyone is very helpful and passionate about their job. fantastic place for families and large parties.  If your a sports fan of any can this is the place  for you ,over 10 led's and great sound systems. A classy sports bar without a doubt.

_2cPUXFGIOy6SbuG_AMRlQ.text: Fun atmosphere, always have sports on and tv's are in view from almost every seat. Good food and drinks!

knvZoBcJ1Mt8eRCmFL-a1Q.text: We happened to stop here and find this place. So Glad W e Did! Yum food, and staff was great with my daughter, pretty quick food too. This would make a great place for groups, thinking of bringing a larger group here! Dog friendly, on the patio!

UbvAGuKPD6ir3JcGVCKNgw.text: The food I felt was 3 star. The beer was 4 star. And the service I felt was 5 star. The staff was friendly even when we were there for a company Christmas party, we showed up late, and it was getting chilly so we asked them to adjust the fire in the patio area. There are other brewhouses I'd pick normally. But this was a pretty darned nice place.

TwxcQS85kFvgH3WBCncZmQ.text: I absolutely loved this place! I ordered the Arizonan and my boyfriend got the prime rib sliders. Both were excellent. For an appetizer we ordered a pretzel which was soft and sooo good. They have pics of dogs everywhere and dogs are allowed on the patio so for an animal lover like me it's great. The service was awesome. Hosted greeted us with a smile and asked how our day was going. The waiter was friendly too. Nice place to relax, watch some games, and have some beers. We will definitely be back.

hmzFQT1Axye5XZwqNtCbFw.text: Nice atmosphere at the Ahwatukee location. Beer a little on the warm side and not too tasty. Retossed wings very good as well as fajitas. Burgers OK, but fries cold. Service OK. Too many other good options in the area to go back. :(

AUZJif7SXQvlxbg9cRSiFQ.text: The beers are ok, nothing special or remarkable.  The service leaves a lot to be desired.  Hopefully better staffed for the dinner service.  Dogs are welcome, a big plus.

fQ7CHiy8JxOP16Heu8TI0g.text: Tried a flight of beers, very nice. Then had a really good cheese dip. The teriyaki burger with grilled pineapple and sweet potatoe fries was really good.

I0xuH-YA5dgpKjRQ4PNnYg.text: My husband and I wanted to try out a new spot and we chose this one. The patio was really nice and the beer was tasty. We even met the brewer. The appetizer pretzel was really soft and warm and the cheese and mustard that accompanied was delish. As for my tic tac toe flatbread and my husbands prime rib sliders they were nothing special. It's a good spot to grab a beer and an appetizer but not sure I will give the entrees another shot.

bfZ3g617lOWjiX78icPW9w.text: Granted this is not a 5-star restaurant. It's just an average bar & grill. We've heard great things about the location in Chandler so we tried this one. We came in at 4:30 on a Friday, well before the evening rush and were seated immediately and that's where the positives end. The music was so loud we could not even have a normal conversation. Our server was...probably the best description is "ambivalent" after he found out we weren't ordering alcohol. Two other parties that were seated after us, who ordered lots of alcohol, had orders taken and served quickly. We got our appetizer but we're almost finished before he took our order. What's worse is our server had obviously been drinking, he had horrible alcohol breath and body odor. We should have just walked out but we had already ordered. I had to ask for a re-fill and my wife's never came. The food was good, basic bar & grill food. Our bill came to $29 and even though I didn't want to tip anything, I left a $4 tip and wrote a note on the bill "Sorry, but the service was just not good tonight". We will not be back to this location and hope the Chandler location fairs better.

TDE8_1O8LKlc7rdhuTLiww.text: With some effort, this new establishment can be a winner. They have yet to understand how to handle showing different NFL games. The TP and soap were out in the bathroom at different times. The food was more than a sports bar, but they had great variety including vegan options.  We enjoyed the shrimp flatbread.

sBxTSJudosUyCqV6FZCzPg.text: This place is charming! I had a berry pomegranate long island. It was yummy and strong enough to be worth the price. I also had the prime rib soup witch may have been the best soup I've ever had. The atmosphere was relaxed and the live music was awesome! Plus I ran into a local celebrity Brian Hand the author of a book I've recently read called Crown of the Underworld. I recognized him from across the bar. Cool little place to be.

WkzpoMqwllLqa_V1IQoeLQ.text: Came for lunch before a movie. We had an hour and we missed the movie because the service was slow. We ordered wings, cheese sticks and a pork sandwich. It took 40 minutes for the food to come out. The chicken wings were raw the cheese sticks were burned and the sandwich was cold. The coleslaw was really good and so were the drinks. Bloody mary was awesome and the long island was really good. The wings got redone and were ok. Get extra hot if you really want hot wings. Hot was really medium. The service was poor. Then when we got our check they had everything billed separately.  Even he alcohol in each drink had separate lines and prices. The side that was supposed to come with the sandwich and was also billed separately , and we were charged an extra dollar for the redone wings. The place  isnt great.

kNex8GFyI88qVmyqS3JxYQ.text: Good food, good service. Liked the quickness of the food especially having 2 little children. Wish they had peanuts that you could eat/throw on the floor.  My son (he is 3) was sad that they didn't have them like some of the other locations do. We had the mandarin beer and it was tasty. 5/6 of us had the pulled pork sliders which were good...A little dry. The fries were the best thing about our experience.

JSbhEg9Id47p04kMKNQv6Q.text: Wings are excellent, especially the salt and peppercorn. Nice crunch on the outside and moist nice off the bone meat. Can't wait to come back in evening to try the prime rib and some brews in the tasting room.

O3n_ieX2JRiWVXklPfAPXQ.text: STUPID EXPENSIVE!!! Girl's lunch for 2...burgers, fries & a couple of beers each...$70 before tip!!! Food was good. Service adequate.

vlEg3kjOpUP9OlCCHo_08g.text: Awesome Wings, service was fast and friendly. Next Time I Will be bringing my poodle with me to hang out on the patio. I ordered a Chihuahua Burger and Fries. My Husband Got wings which was amazing!! And you can bring your dog on the patio.  Place was Clean and Decor inside was nice out server was Katie who was nice and friendly helped us with the menu. We will defiantly be back. Music was Great To.

wZ5a8195aFc3aIyh0WfQtw.text: Nice pet friendly place. The Peanut butter Porter beer is a must have at this place. The mojito it'd also really good.I had a flat bread and it was really good. I would definitely come back here.

HiePcixmBokRR5aFkPCCGw.text: My husband and I dined here last weekend.  Once we were sat, we waited 10 min before our waiter greeted us, although we did see him walk past the table (without acknowledging us), many times. We ordered drinks, which sat at the bar 10 min before being delivered. There were multiple other patrons that appeared equally as annoyed with his lack of urgency in all his tasks. It was as though he had no ability to multitask or even acknowledge that people were clearly waiting on him. Although he was incredibly slow and unaware, what was most annoying, is that he sat down, in the table behind us, to eat his dinner. He had at least 2-3 tables, and he was sitting eating dinner ? I was a server for many years throughout college - I would've been written up in a second if I sat and ate in front of my customers. My husband actually had to interrupt our servers meal to ask for a side item.  It was so incredibly flippant - for a table of 5-6 servers to sit in the booth behind us and eat, while tables were waiting for service. It was extremely disappointing. I tried to email the manager to notify him - they didn't respond

K1uM16N0QGm9CJOYvqLHEA.text: I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone! We were a party of 4ppl on a Sunday for lunch, they were 3 tables on the patio and in the bar/dining area they were 6 tables in total (so really quiet) for the number of employees. The server that took "care" of us wasn't really friendly and very slow. We tried 3 different beers that they make in the establishment, neither were good and all were bitter! We also tried the "sangria" let me just save you $7.50, it's grape juice in a wine glass with an ice cube! I checked the time when we ordered the food and when we actually received it and it took 43 mins. We were looking at 4 plates under the light at the food station for 10 mins, all the servers were walking checking the food and didn't take them, and than our server realized that it was HIS TABLE. When we finally had the chance to taste the food it wasn't tasty. Definitely not going back.

1WD0Q6OF-3GQE_vZSjD4sg.text: My bf and I came here bc we tried the beer from here at another restaurant. We wanted to check out the brewery gor ourselves so we made out way out here for out Friday date night.  Enviorment- clean and open. The theme of this restaurant is a dog house and their decor definitely lives up to it... in a good way!  Service- our waitress was okay. She took forever to greet us, bring us water, take our order, bring our check and so on.  Food- very very Eh, that's the best way to describe it. My fries were cold, my wings were over cooked and extremely salty!!! Wings are my FAVORITE type of food and this was just disappointing...I ate 3 out of 12 because they were soooo salty and dry. If I were you I would just come here for the beer, which was also just okay.   :(

ukE7_RfS4PPk4WHHvtRe4w.text: I was in Phoenix for work, and took my boss to meet up with a friend at Uncle Bear's for dinner. Great atmosphere! We watched a game in the World Series and it was a blast.   Though a great place to hang, the food we had, and the drinks, were sub-par. The majority of the beer tasted the same to me, and no one was impressed with their entrees. The appetizers were standard bar food. Set your expectations for a good atmosphere and ok food, and you're set! Service was fantastic, also, which helped.

pwHyjqpvwmj6q_7Q6exLLA.text: To be upfront, I did not have a full meal here. We stopped in for a beer (after going to the gym, like a boss). I was pleased with the number of house brews they had on tap.    They had 13 of their own as well as a selection of other beers. We had an order of garlic Parmesan fries to go with our beers.  I tried their peanut butter porter, which was to die for! The side of fries was a large serving considering we ordered the side instead of a full basket. It was more than enough for two to eat as a appetizer. They were excellent! I glanced at the menu and it had a good selection of burgers, tacos, and other bar-style food.   The restaurant itself was nice. There were tvs everywhere and it was Sunday afternoon so they had football on all the tvs. Behind the bar were garage doors which were open to a large fenced in patio with a fireplace.  Overall it was a good experience for a little side trip and I look forward to going back for a full meal, or maybe another post-workout treat!

RqiJh84rDHLyLsooDan07A.text: We ordered wings, queso,  mac n cheese, sloppy Joe and chicken tenders.  Not a very impressive order to be sure, but it still should've lived up to its typical standards.  But, it did not.   While the wings were good and meaty, everything else feel way short.  The sloppy Joe was the consistency of wet dog food and did not taste good.  The Mac n cheese was flavor less ( it's bad when a 4 year old is asking for salt and pepper ).  The fries were battered and greasy.  The chicken tenders and the queso dip were decent though.  The wait staff was excellent; however,  this review is for the food alone.  Step up the quality of the food to match the high prices, and this place would be decent.  Good beer selection.

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Bear's Grill & Tap - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Good Meaty Wings
Photo of Uncle Bear's Grill & Tap - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Queso - Decent.

jmgP0Rj_s1FIrXnSR8UZkA.text: Not a beer expert or a beer snob but have to say the beer they brew here is very good. Atmosphere is good and food is great. Went and saw Roger Kline here a wile back and it was a hoot.. You can go here by yourself and not feel out of place. I have actually made some good friends here.  Cant wait to go back.

teu1l-OzaK4oDBsbK0vbvw.text: It pays to know a local. We came here at the suggestion of my cousin, who lives in the area. We arranged to meet here after a text exchnage.  The beer was fine. I had the flight, which allowed me to taste several of them. My favorite was the Hop Dog, a double IPA. Other reviews mention that the beer is not as cold as it could or should be. Good point Yelpers....  The food was fine as well. Our group of four, had Mango-Hot wings, poppers and garlic-parm fries as appetizers. I thought the wings were not very meaty and the sauce just tasted OK. The poppers were fine. The garlic-parm fries had enough garlic to make you vampire-proof. My wife had the basic burger but changed her side to the side salad. Later, she was talking about wanting to go back for that salad, so I guess it was good. I had the Herd's burger, which from their menu and website, looks like it has it's roots in some Texas burger joint. I asked for medium, but the burger is subjected to some special meat-chopping-griddle-cooking process they said it can only be prepared well done. OK.. fine. The burger was decent. There was something spicy. Not sure if it was the mustard or the pepper-jack cheese I asked for. I upgraded to onion rings. That cost another $1.50.  We had a really good server named Aaron who took excellent care of us and even shook our hands when we left. The dog themed ambiance is kinda cool and the food and beer are fine. I know that's not exactly a glowing endorsement, but service like that gets them an extra star and a half.

HPBHg-olSMVJhaTLwZZl8g.text: I can't stand when a waiter doesn't come back a few minutes before happy hour to see if you want another beer. Dude was like a ghost. Also, the sliders I ordered were more bread than anything. I think I had a full bun left with what I tore off from the sides of all them that were literally just extra plain bread. Also, my friend ordered double tossed wings (which you pay extra for) and I swear they didn't toss them again after grilling them. They were really dry and he ended up asking for sauce on the side. If that is how they are supposed to be, I wouldn't recommend paying the extra $ for them.

rpadf1RwvtqsOKz8y8M1eA.text: Service was excellent, she made recommendations & brought samples quickly...house margarita was as good as their label beers...food was timely & flavorable...exceptional sliders, salads, grilled cheese, fish & frys! ReAsonable prices for sure. Can't wait to go back!

Uq-4nM9YE3zGWL1PstrTCQ.text: I went in on a rainy Monday evening a few weeks ago and really liked it. Great beer, good burger deal. How they serve the burger is a bit odd. The Mac and cheese was ordinary. But, it's a solid choice if you're nearby. Beats BJ's

EvdRaaFh7zc05z12BTEY9w.text: Really nice comfortable place.  We had lunch at the bar and the bartender was so nice.  The chicken wings are so yummy! Prices good.  Lots of TVs to watch sports on.  Plus next to the movies catch a nice show after.

zwI6aLnAy-Lqn4ZZL8XTQg.text: I thought I would test out this sports bar with a salad as an entree and I will give credit where credit is due....the greens were a good mix and fresh. Not some chopped up iceberg! Chicken was tasty and plentiful, they threw in a handful of diced red peppers and served it with a good sweet sesame dressing.   My partner in crime had a decent pepperoni pizza.  They always offer good friendly service and a fun atmosphere.   Thanks Uncle Bears!

68vwOBTkRMd_cixkZCpAMQ.text: Fabulous customer service. Tasty, crispy, beer battered fries. Burgers full of flavor. And kind servers who smile and chat with you. I had an issue with my daughter's food today, but they were on it and made us feel important, taking care of it to the fullest. I've been a regular customer here for a couple years and I will continue to do so.

1rIJYu2sOf0PIzLnnZnmlA.text: Good selection of beers. Brooke was an excellent bartender and my glass  (both water and beer) was never totally empty before she checked in with me. She also made good recommendations on which beers to get in the flight. My original plan was just to pop in for a flight and leave but ended up staying much longer than intended since I was having fun.   The patio is dog friendly too.

mWUAq7l9kwgb2y7KxHBybQ.text: Disappointing. Most brew restaurants make good or at least serviceable beers. Not here. The 2 IPAs tasted were not. One lousy, one undrinkable. Chemical tasting, something not right. The Stout was ok, but way too light and quite tasteless.   Wings were good, house salad very good. I think food here is better than the beer by a long shot.    Atmosphere very good, nice outdoor bars and tables.   Sorry, won't be back.

LSRz2XbryqG6lAhUYgljyQ.text: I visited this place for the first time with my husband last weekend and was surprised to find that they brew their own beer. I was pretty excited about that and so I ordered the sampler to try them all and she even gave me a small shot of the stout which was not included in the sampler. Most of the beers had pretty good flavor but not enough of it. They were just a little too thin and tasted watered down. Some I liked more than others but really they all were lacking in body. The food is basic bar food: burgers, pizza, a bunch of fried appetizers. Their wings were pretty tasty but everything else was just ok. I don't think the burgers and fries are fresh made in house. I probably would not come here again for the food since it was a pretty boring menu but I might stop in for a pint before watching a movie at the AMC next door. So, here are my thoughts on their beers:  Dog Paddle Wheat - It may just have been the power of suggestion since I read the description before tasting but I really did get the notes of coriander in the flavor. This is a nice and light summer beer but I really didn't get a wheat flavor or mouthfeel at all like you would in a hefe. I'd try this one again when it's hot out and probably like it a lot better. I think it would go great with some Mexican food.  Fence Jumper - Description says oats were involved but apparently not enough to release any proteins because again it seemed watered down. Flavor was very bland as well but then I'm just not a light beer type of girl. Order this one if you are used to Budweiser. You'll probably like it.  Head to Tail Amber - Well usually amber is my favorite but again there was a lack of flavor and body. I will say that it was a really good balance between the malt and the hops. Not a bad beer just a little too dry for me. Hubby had ordered an Angry Orchard and we did try mixing the two (they offer this as an option on their menu) and we both agreed that was very good!  Dog Park Dark Ale - This is a great beer. Really well done. Excellent flavor. I love the deep malty beers though so this is just right up my alley. Again, light body but that's ok because it means you can drink more without filling up! If you like the taste of Guinness but not the heaviness give this a try.  Ocean Beach West Coast IPA - I don't really drink IPAs but this one was ok. Not too hoppy so I guess that's why they classified it as west coast. I did get the citrus taste mentioned in the description so I bet this one would be good in the summer, too.  Dog's Out Stout - I always love a good stout and this one was no exception. Not too much sweetness there - it was a little dry but still great depth of flavor. Again the body was lacking which was a disappointments since usually stouts have a nice creamy mouthfeel to them.  I ordered a pint of the dark ale and confirmed that this is the best beer of the bunch (to my palate at least). I wouldn't mind drinking any of them again but I wouldn't necessarily seek them out either. I hope they keep working on improving the recipes because at least they are on the right track.

g9BTB547asvRaX1RemuatQ.text: We went out with a bunch of our friends and almost everyone hated their food. BBQ chicken pizzas were lacking flavor, the Asian Chicken salad was horrible. My dressing for the salad was basically sweet Thai chilly sauce you get at Trader Joe's. Yes, that was my dressing. The texture of the sauce is not meant to be on a salad. The chicken was rock hard. The chicken was basically covered in batter. The Parmesan fries were soggy. My wings I paid extra for it to be grilled didn't look it was grilled at all. The flavor I got on the wings-garlic parmesan, there was no flavor of that sort on my wings. Our other friend ordered a mildly hot chicken pizza, she said their hot sauce basically covered the whole pizza. It was gross. Our friends had similar complaints as we all basically had the same thing. Our waitress was very nice. It's not her fault the food was not very good.

U0K9ER-esoX1RefO9HkRcA.text: Make sure that Larry is your bartender and you get the french fries (you will crave them). They have steak fries and beer battered fries.

_x3zWmfGqK-9MMWNdl9Z3A.text: I had Uncle Bear's on my radar for a couple years and finally made a trip after a hike on nearby South Mountain. I had heard of the famed peanut butter cup Porter and of course had to have a taste of that (and others too)! I ordered a flight which comes with 5 4-oz pours, my selection including the Beach Bum Tropical IPA, Holiday Hound Winter Ale, Peanut Butter Cup Porter, See Me Rollin' Cinnamon Roll Brown Ale, and their nitro stout (forgot its name). While a lot of the beers were par to slightly better (the peanut butter cup porter wasn't as good as I had anticipated), the cinnamon brown ale was absolutely fantastic! The cinnamon notes really complemented the malt character and it was total heaven in my mouth. The tropical IPA was also pretty good, reminiscent of some of the IPAs I used to drink living close to SD.  So what makes this place a 4-star joint instead of an average 3? Good service and their willingness to go unconventional, think outside the box. My friend ordered their PBJ Burger and thoroughly enjoyed it. Taking that kind of bold risk to put a unique food item on your menu earns some kudos in my book. Keep it up, UB's! Might make it back before the season's end for more of that cinnamon ale!

uk5X-m01hYa_rXUZHf8GGw.text: So!  While I was waiting for my sister, I had some time to kill. Drove around and found this spot.  First of all, the fact that they are a local brewery is amazing. Supporting local business is super important. I only tried few things during my visit.  Uncle Brew IPA, delicious. So much flavor. PLUS, every beer sold, $1 dll will be donated to a dog charity. (Also their other beer selection looks pretty good). Happy hour 3-7 pm MON-FRI.  Food was ok, at least the chicken wings. I got the spicy buffalo with a charcoal touch. The chicken needed slightly more time in the oven and flavor, meh!.  I am pretty sure there are way more things that taste way better, but my visit was super quick.  Enjoy!

9lzAN0Tr0FP2N5ehZLbTvQ.text: Meh... seems kind of blah next to the other restaurant options. The pizza was picture perfect but the taste was only so-so. The bleu cheese burger has just chunky bleu cheese dressing on top. (It was good just not memorable)  It seems like a good place for a beer and happy hour but the food itself is nothing to write home about and the restaurant blends into the gray abyss of meh.  I think the prices are high compared to quality of food too.

aNQMyUOLXoqmA0_7sJCkQA.text: Not a fan of this place at all...the service was not that great. Our food was not that great either. I was not impressed at all. I might give it another try bc they do seem so dog friendly but that was a bit confusing too?! Do they allow dogs or only service dogs? Hmm

J9uGzkSf4FY9Ahj2yRhdKA.text: (Lyrics - Uncle Kracker - Follow Me)  I don't know how I met you  I don't know why I can't turn around  And say goodbye  All I know is when I'm with you  You make me eat and drink through your brews Like a fish in the sea  I'm Yelping Uncle Bear and every drink is all right I'll be the one to Yelp you at the end of the night And when I leave I can guarantee You won't ever find no Yelper just like me!  Uncle Bear's Brewery is a nice neighborhood brewery serving up some delectable food!    I came here after my a full marathon run so I was totally hungry and ready for a brew!  I'm generally a big IPA fan, but I didn't like the taste of the one they had that day and went for the amber instead.    For our food, my partner and I both shot for the burgers!  She ordered the Shroom while I ordered The Herd; sirloin beef, onions, mayo, lettuce and tomatoes, cooked on a flat top.  Overall it was done to perfection with a medium rare, just the way I like it!  The patty itself was crumbly with every bite, but I rather like that texture as I pick up the small pieces and stuffed it in my mouth!  You're not getting away food!  Overall, my visit was fun!  The service was real good and on top of things.  What weird me out was the dog pictures on my menu.  I know the theme of the restaurant was dogs and don't get me wrong I love them!  However, having them on the menu while I ordered my burger made me felt bad; granted the running joke and yes I'm Asian! Haha! - Enjoy!
