akjayLOd_ZjSBa7rzzb-uw.text: The beer wasn't all that great! Was fairly average. The ambiance was not exactly brewery like but the bartender was awesome and helpful. He was quite knowledgeable about the beer. I didn't try the food but based on beer alone I give it the three stars.

B4G4Vc8JvRlAck0kcelT_g.text: Much better experience this time! Glad to have come back to give this place another shot! We were in on Saturday Night (1-20-27) after my daughters gymnastics meet. It was after 8PM.  Party of 13. Servers accommodated our needs, put tables together for our large party. They were "on top of it"... Not a long wait! We had two servers that were outstanding!! Food was great. Onion rings are soooo good!  Grilled Cheese was enjoyed by one of our patrons as well as the MAC n Cheese! Comfort Food at its best!  Burgers are fantastic! Only negative NO fresh eggs??! My hubby LOVES the BBQ Big Dog Burger with an "over easy" egg on top! All they had were hard boiled..:( We will be back again. Keep up the great customer service & good food!

w-G4fxqfv4B_j1ZINVyoVQ.text: Good atmosphere. Dogs welcome! Tasted the Tropical IPA and Mutts Nuts, but wasn't impressed. I usually like IPAs though. Settled on the Mandarin Wheat. Tasted just like a Blue Moon. Also ordered Cheddar Fries. They were a good, simple appetizer. Also do not order the Mandarosa, waste of money, just order a regular mimosa. Overall good place to hang out.

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Bear's Grill & Tap - Phoenix, AZ, United States

gcfI0D_hs_j8qvUCtEadPg.text: Love your pets?   Love beer?   Love great service?   If you're looking for a spot to sit on the patio with your dogs, sip a beer or three, watch tv while eating good food, then Uncle Bears is the place for you.    They're making their own beers and have a huge selection to choose from.  They also have a big menu for those undecided on what to get.  I highly recommend the queso and chips and the baked pretzel for apps and their half and half combo for lunch which is soup or salad served with wings, a sandwich or pizza.    The side salad was ridiculous.  It was like an entree salad, fresh and delicious.  I paired it with a taster of the peanut butter porter then their bulldog peach tea drink which had sweet tea vodka, peach schnapps, lemonade and a lemon wedge.     The manager came around to the tables outside to make sure the pups had ample ice water which I truly appreciate.  They opened their doors to us two legged humans and our fur babies.

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Bear's Grill & Tap - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Side salad as big as an entree salad elsewhere
Photo of Uncle Bear's Grill & Tap - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bulldog Peach Tea...Yum

4Mpwshd6xSs_7ZtTXMntpw.text: This place was just ok. Food took a long time to get to the table and was very expensive. The place was not busy but the service was lacking. Probably won't go back.

essPGNaPz8h5HEs3cK4fVg.text: We have been visiting this restaurant for over five years.  Two years ago it was poor service and all about the brewery.  We stopped coming and try to give this local restaurant a fair shake every year.  But to no avail we consistently get Trash service which is slow. We ordered at 5:15, it is 6:00 and we still haven't gotten our food, I ordered some chips and salsa and it still hasn't come. How hard is it to make chips and salsa....

ye5aUUIwZKZvJd6WEvoL-w.text: Went for a family dinner.  The service was great and the restaurant was clean.  The food was just "ok".  Nothing to write to Mom about except the sweet potato fries.. the bomb.  Crispy on the outside and soft on the inside.  They were the right size too.   Ice cream was pre-scooped and refrozen though the didn't taste like freezer burned.   I gave it 3 stars because I didn't love the food but I also didn't hate it so in the middle of the road.

emI9jj6fMO-7J3rsXIoikQ.text: This place is great! One of the only places I crave for wings. Got to try them grilled and re-tossed. It's the only way.   Very chill environment with friendly service. We also had the philly sliders. My wife loved them and there was plenty to share. Enjoyed tasting a couple of good beers too. The tropical pale and an IPA.   We're looking forward to come back to try the pizza. I hear it's good.   Skip the desert.

ywHXCB52M5xWk9-ZigJrWA.text: Take out order messed up so now I wait. From what I've seen of my order so far I'm not impressed with the portion sizes. Kids pizza, Asian salad and avocado in particular.

Ku7wWQCZ8Kg2Imv2bVxUTQ.text: This is more so a 2.5 Star review.Come here for beer and friendly staff, but nothing more. I received a rock-hard like-warm chicken sandwich that I only took two bites of. Luckily the side salad was great and served on a chilled plate. The brisket sandwich was good, but pretty greasy. Like I said, come for the beer!

cpiH7fl91qb-nChw9A4OUg.text: The best dog-friendly eatery in Phoenix! The service was wonderful with a very accomodating menu for a picky party.  We brought our dog, an 80-pound pit bull, worried that he would get the side-eye for being a pittie, but instead everyone gushed over him.  Nice selection of beers to boot, but when you are kind to me and my dog, that is what really matters!

VdOWAaghpkQRP4SAEqlXCQ.text: Unimpressed.  It was 9 pm on a Wednesday night. Went here after a geek trip to watch Wrath of Kahn at the Ahwatukee 24.  Aside from the five of us, there were two other patrons. The service was OK. My pulled pork sandwich was not. Others in my group were underwhelmed as well.  Not much else to say.

8KDs8FQDsbLmXJN47Bizsw.text: Their beers are awesome. My favs: Peanut butter porter, coffee Milk stout, manderin wheat and ocean Beach IPA.  Food was reallly good. We got the steak fries with brisket  and a dozen wings of both the dry rubs. My favorite was the Cajun but my gf loved the salt and pepper. So good!

NAcPcxKp-XiSkyXVlX5CsA.text: Cheap cosmos, great wings and an awesome atmosphere! Check out their happy hour! This place is awesome! We really love the double and west coast IPAs.

bolmaBBiPCmWMyNt_zC9Ng.text: Stopped in Uncle Bears for a couple of beers after going to the movies.  The bar was dirty and the beer wasn't very cold. Instead of keeping their beer glasses in the freezer they just press them over this mister to make them temporarily cold.  Also, a large beer was $7.50, at Native New Yorker that same beer would be $3.50.

rbEvDuv5ZQ6xoT2ohOaArQ.text: This place blows! Not even deserving of one star. I ordered a pub burger but they served me a flat cookie cutter pattie! Do restaurants make their own patties anymore?! I couldn't finish burger so left it there with one bite out of it. The manager asked if I wanted something else, but I didn't want to chance it. He didn't even offer to take it off my tab!  Screw this place! Next time I'll just head to Mellow Mushroom instead.

xfc1E3v0xEKZvGsuZxukSg.text: Food and service were mediocre at best; their in-house wheat stout tasted like turpentine. Blech! The bring-your-dog-on Saturday theme was different but I don't really want my dogs or other people's pets in an eating and drinking establishment, so count me out.

w22NwdhTecJtvSGCee6BAA.text: This place is the unhealthy equivalent of Hillside Spot Cafe!  Their brews are top notch. They also have Descutes' Black Butte Porter which I recommend.   We had wings: Dark Ale BBQ and Sea Salt and Peppercorn Grind; I recommend the latter!

IpkB8JJA0-tQ9tQN0jbSsw.text: ok had a bad experience before but been back several times good food, and good service!! Staff is friendly and a good double ipa

YiYr832JBBv_3_CxuI-Dig.text: Went for lunch and it wasn't terribly busy. They were already out of their pretzel appetizer, which was disappointing. Waited over 50 minutes to get out food (2 hamburgers and a kids veggie plate). When the food finally did arrive the order was wrong, onion rings weren't ready, and ranch for the veggies was missing. We asked the expediter to get the ranch, but he never came back. The manager did come over to apologize (which was the right thing to do) but the damage was already done. The fries with the second (kids) burger were cold too.   Maybe wait a month for them to iron out the kinks before trying this place. If lunch was that slow, I'd hate to see dinner service.

l4L8Gpr0ekHfw7fQdEIsKg.text: I wish I could have tried the beer and the food, but after we were seated for 20 minutes nobody showed up to serve us. Should have listened to the reviews first, the service sucked. Won't be back to give it another try.

tGV6lj8B1EwxZ53v11CY0g.text: Anyone like myself looking for the hottest wings on the planet will not be disappointed !   These are the real deal with legit ghost peppers and gloves.  I say bring it!  Anyone in Ahwatukee looking for a really cool vibe with great beer and food needs to visit.  Dog friendly, bring your best friend and sit on the patio!!  Finally a cool place to hang out.  See you here!

NTOxdXEm_rTMLQBRntBhOw.text: Good food, good beer, good environment. The mandarin Wheat Ale was great. Spicy Chicken tacos and sliders were good and big portions. Great for the price too

a97Qsi0WJvqjqapCleX4uw.text: This is really good food. A little loud, but nothing to much. The chicken tenders are great! Very good fries, salads are legit and good-sized. New Mexico burger wad excellent.

e2x4gpN52jWryFGUGZtVzQ.text: Pardon my french but... holy shit!!!   Everything about this place is simply amazing!  Their food is to die for, they beer is beyond amazing and service can't be compare. It was our first time here but will definitely not be our last!  Can't wait to be back already!

NfzQjbMsOyKfOYjq4Xmdjg.text: The menu has a nice variety of choices.  Try the shredded pork flatbread!  Real tasty. They brew their own beers too.  The Amber was excellent.  Great bar set up and there are plenty of TVs. ASU game vs USC was prominently displayed.  Welcome to ahwatukee!

ZgyMcWUMdeCHsd41rrRDCg.text: The place looks nice, I liked the atmosphere.  However the bartenders were not friendly.  We had to wave to get service and we were never checked on. Our sliders took a long time.  They came out cold and had no seasoning.   We thought we would it try again,  but when new customers came in, got a hand shake and better service,  we decided not to give this place a second chance.

Vz__RU3aZyCnLnfEzzg7UA.text: Great atmosphere with tons of TV's and ample places to sit; major bonus- you can sit outside with your dog! I loved the cute dog bone designed flight and dry erase beer ordering system. Prices were a little on the high side for a neighborhood bar but the awesome service made up for it. We ordered the pretzel to start which had a surprisingly good mustard sauce. The seasonal Pale Ale came a little on the bitter side but was definitely my favorite. My boyfriend enjoyed the Dark Ale with just a hint of chocolate/ espresso taste. We also filled our growler and they offered to give us another growler of their design if we paid for a second refill! Now that's an awesome deal

l8-oqOaypWow0thAVPEzcA.text: Fun environment great atmosphere awesome food good drinks tv's everywhere all the games and they have there own brewery doesn't get better than that

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Bear's Grill & Tap - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ceaser salad and the Mexican burger with frys AMAZING

6dLpR3z8lRKWAWOLhkPfTg.text: Two beers were the worst craft beers I have ever had - the bartender had no personality and minimal communication skills - I'm scratching my head why anyone would return - oh, great location and weather!

B5-5BF7oGTw5ICtNzbLh1A.text: Cool place to check out! Beer and food are pretty good and the atmosphere is worth going for sure.

ZHbZ7YKBo8Bm7KauBEvfyw.text: Great food, prices, beer and service. Right next to AMC, another great addition to Ahwatukee.

qagiXhgDRtrBzRu_Tz0dXA.text: Solid lunch specials, I had a Herd's burger with a generous side salad.  Great flavor and quality!  Then a berry tart to end a great meal.  Variety menu and nice atmosphere for an overall great experience.  It was doggone awesome!

rP_mOFB7IBgHuPrNxuPqVA.text: When we walked in, I thought I was in heaven.  The place is not only dog-friendly, but they have beautiful, fun dog shaped decor.  I ordered the basic burger with no onion, tomatoes or mustard, only lettuce and ketchup.  I also ordered onion rings in place of fries.  My burger came with onions, tomatoes and mustard - no lettuce or ketchup - with fries on the side.  I told the waiter and he apologized and promised to fix the error.  My second burger came with nothing but the patty and mustard - no lettuce or ketchup.  By this time, they had brought my onion rings so I could eat something during the burger catastrophe.  The third burger attempt produced just a patty - no lettuce or ketchup.  I asked the waiter to get those items for me and he brought those on the side.  He apologized and murmured something about the new burger process, blah, blah, blah.  My husband ordered the mac and cheese with shrimp which he enjoyed.  I figured the restaurant would comp our drinks or my burger, but nada.  I was extremely disappointed.

M7BKukENEpH1-eg3wc4W9g.text: Been here a few times and every time we sit outside. Nice you can see TV's from outside plus they have heaters. Not certain what the law is about smoking when you're technically outside but so close to the open side of the restaurant. Liked all their beers. Wings were good. Beer cheese was super thick and delicious. Mac and cheese with chicken was super good!  You can even being your dogs!

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Bear's Grill & Tap - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Flight on a bone :)

P6qiP_n-Vpghx4gXFXfTEQ.text: Bacon cheeseburger...A+  Fries...A++  Service...A++  Growler of Double IPA to go...  A MUST try and RETURN in Ahwatukee!!  Close to I10 with plenty of parking.  ALSO:  DOG friendly!! Very impressed!!

haJFLj2KzbM05PBiI0iR5Q.text: Good food!!! The Beer is good!!!! To many variances in the serving glasses of the beer! Temperature is a big problem for me beer needs to be colder and so far I really like everything I've tasted.

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Bear's Grill & Tap - Phoenix, AZ, United States. DOG PARK AND BURGER

IBWV8RlrTnA_YVjI_PaDCQ.text: This is one if my favorite places in Ahwatukee. I love this place. The atmosphere and the food are excellent. I'm a low carber and they cater to my type. I almost always order the chili which is awesome. The chili and wings are an inexpensive meal with your choice of beer, golden. Can't go wrong with the burgers, I always ask to hold the bun. My biggest issue and the only reason why I dinged them to two stars was the service. Typically, I've had good service. Never been great but good enough. Tonight we had a young lady (don't remember her name but she had tattoos across her collarbone), she was friendly too but she was super slow. It took forever to get my wings and chili and it wasn't busy! She forgot my father's cocktail order. It was bad.  I'll come back but not for the service and with lower expectations.

bKDYCv71n6YG1iQEWPGNeg.text: Very unique and cool theme to restaurant. The food is also great! I recommend the Buffalo chicken pizza and baked pretzel. Service tends to be a little slow at times.

eh96NPKOpaIHhscjHgv0KQ.text: Boyfriend and I came here. We ordered pints of the breweries beer on HH and they were decent! We both ordered wings and my boyfriend absolutely loved them. But me... Not so much. I like mine super saucy and these lacked sauce. Another problem I ran into is I got half garlic Parmesan as recommendation from our server. Bad decision. I'm sure they would have been good to a person that isn't obsessed with sauciness. I am giving 4 stars since my boyfriend loved their wings though. He likes them not too saucy and crispy, and they came out just like that. If you're into sauciness, maybe tell your server to not skimp on the sauce? Lol I'm sure it is not a problem to fix. Also, another cool thing about this place: they are dog friendly from what I remember! Bring your well behaved pup to the patio!

kxacG7Uc3QlVHPJvvWDzEw.text: The beer is ok.  The food is rather good for bar fare.  Having your dog come out to dinner with you on the patio is great.  Happy hour has some good deals with the sliders probably being my favorite.  There are lots of TVs but don't think of this as a sports bar or you'll be disappointed.  It's just a family restaurant that brews its own beer

OeYXK8qp1YxkC6rfiDDdhA.text: Good for with a decent offering for Happy Hour.  The boneless wings are tasty and the burgers are large enough to share.

b7OefSJs8_IaM0DwsrmXEQ.text: First time in last night . Food was great very generous portions.  Server was very attentive kept checking to see if we needed anything.  Beer was  great. I will be back!    Had the peanut butter porter. WOW! Way out delicious.

6h6FAIHG5DfFQ7ZM2RgzZg.text: If you're going to open a brewpub you need three absolutes. Good beer, fish and chips, and a decent handmade pub burger. This place has nasty beer, no fish, and horrible hamburgers!! Nice place with shiny beer equipment, HOWEVER, this place just sucks!! Service was great, management was clueless. If you order a Hop Dog IPA, it damn sure better have some hops in it!! Make YOUR OWN hamburger patties!! Preformed frozen patties are an embarrassment to your location.   Either get it right or get out of the way and make room for somebody who can do it better.  All in all, skip it and go get a slice at Vimcents!!

UzAxHl4j8Qfk586pIq5R8Q.text: Pretty solid 3 stars here. Nothing extraordinary but nothing really disappointing either. There are better brewpubs in the area though. The drinks were good and the one I had was really strong. The potato soup was all right, but I feel like Paradise Bakery has better bread bowls. Fish and chips were decent, and there was an all right beer selection. The outside area was nice and the fire was cozy for those few months in Phoenix where it gets chilly in the evening. Service was friendly and pretty on top of things.

eMShBA1y2iYn_Jd6R95gug.text: Who doesn't love a nice craft brewery spot? We've seen Four Peaks, we've seen Papago...I prefer Uncle Bears as an establishment over both. I'm not saying the beer is better; there are some fine tuning and tweaking to recipes that need to occur. It is still damn tasty brewage though! From a front of the house perspective, UB's delivers.  The bar itself has a great set up. Changing lights, some TV's...it's right on par with what you'd expect. It is very clean and modern. No grungy craft bar feel to it. If you didn't see the brewing equipment in the back, you probably wouldn't even know the brew their own shit.   Food is great as well. Try any of the sliders, they're all outstanding. Wings are very good as well. Service is ideal. There when you did them, not all up in your grill every 5 minutes asking, "Is everything okay?" Just the right amount.  Food? Excellent. Beer? Excellent. Service? Excellent. Stop on by, but not on Friday. It's already packed enough and I don't want you taking my seat.

gh-1mrsRVy-_0DHPHp7hNw.text: Awesome location. Service staff is great, menu is expansive, decor is solid, and there are TVs just about everywhere you look. It's a great destination for gameday, whatever that may be for you. The menu has a little bit of everything to offer, and is better than your average pub grub. I've always been fond of the chicken ceasar salad, good stuff! They have microbrews, with seasonals on rotation.Their in-house IPA is great, I go for it every time. Bears now offers growlers to take their brew home with you!  It's $5 to buy the growler and then $12 each fill. The place is great for kids with a decent little menu, and there's canine decor everywhere to keep your kiddos busy. I would definitely recommend.

Q7K10Ce8Dtk_WDItTC9BMA.text: 1st let me tell you, this is Uncle Bear's Brewhouse Grill. Not Uncle Bear's Bar and Grill! Big difference, menu's are different, the ambiance is different. Just wanted to get that out of the way before I start this thing! Wife and I was in Tempe to see our Daughter and boyfriend. Brought our little princess with us, daughter said there was an Uncle Bear's nearby! Now Uncle Bear's in well known pet friendly establishment, always a great place for your pooch. Now of course this was on a Saturday night, all of you kids have nothing to do except taking up space! (saying this with a grin) So we had to wait for a table outside, now what I did not like was instead of using the usual led vibrator to let you know your table is ready. They ask for your cell phone so they can text you! That's one way of saving money I guess.  Now to the food and service. When we finally got seated, we were told since we were on the patio our service was going to be slower? So I asked him why are we second class compare to the dining room! He immediately changed his wording to since there are a lot of people here our service is behind. Since he realized I wasn't going take any crap from him, our service was pretty quick. ;-)  The menu was OK a lot different from Uncle Bear's Bar and Grill, I was in the mood for a Crispy Chicken Salad. But they did not offer that there, I also wanted the Jalapeno Poppers appetizer. They again did not offer that there! That's when I realized I had to look at their menu. So I ended up ordering their soft pretzel with cheese and sauce. This was a good thing, pretzel was baked with a butter topping. This was probably the best thing I ate that night. I ordered their slow cooked ribs, I was assuming they were going to be more like a BBQ style ribs. Oops! it was more like a pot roast style. I had their veggie's and mashed potato's with my meal. Overall the good was good, not what I was expecting. Service was OK, and the food was OK. There is a reason why I live in Surprise, to get away from this crowd!

k_iZJ_U3o0nHdotbfn771w.text: I went to refill a growler.  After several minutes they could not find the hose to fill it.  I was very patient and understood.  Then I watched them fill my growler without the hose.  I expressed that I was concerned about the head on the growler.  They seemed irritated with me, and asked me to "bear with them". I said no problem and waited patiently.  He gave me a 4oz sample on the house after I already purchased a drink and growler.  After some time he handed me my growler and he explained, " just a heads up, it's good to have some head for the carbonation."  Pretty sure that it's better to have less oxygen in the growler so it lasts longer. Very disappointed, as I brag about this place.  Going to fill my growlers elsewhere now.

wxVs9IkxcFeiBZ2u_rEVWg.text: 1st time in..not a big poster unless really good or really bad. came in for Father's Day to watch game 7 of the NBA finals and food was great,atmosphere was good, little warm in restaurant but 120 deg outside- what you gonna do. All killed by the service we received  from our waitress, we were there for an hour and our waitress came to table 3 times and last visit was after we had to ask another waiter for our check. I want to try this place again but if the service is that bad again it doesn't matter how good the beers and food is.  I will leave another review when we go back after I forget how bad this visit was!!!!  Hope this was a fluke because food and beers are worth another try but I am in the service biz as well and if we experience this type of service again they won't ever see us again and word of mouth will get around.

Q4MQoz463E0aQ0wwE9AG0g.text: Great atmosphere! Food is good wait staff could be a little more attentive. Beers have things to do with dogs. Support for animals especially dogs.

eQQLioyfFn0qXlDtiut-7w.text: I ordered a BLT made with Texas toast and got a BLT made with Texas butt bread. They even presented it butt down, so the good toast was on top. They knew they were wrong for even using the butt; that's why they hid it. They can't blame it on being busy because it was 2:30pm. And because I ordered delivery through UberEats, they knew I couldn't send it back. I don't know what kind of crazies work in that kitchen but c'mon man! Who eats the butt?? Bunch of jerks. To be fair though, their BLT is delicious. I ate Texas butt and I cannot lie. It would be nice if the butt was bigger though; then maybe I wouldn't mind eating the butt.

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Bear's Grill & Tap - Phoenix, AZ, United States

viLYYXLo_ZJxwPQ97HSBeQ.text: Ordered a meal for 3 people for a lunch through Grubhub.  Not only was  I missing condiments that I requested, we also got moldy bread.  Took it up with Grubhub.  Grubhub called the restaurant and they would not offer a refund for the moldy food.  Mind you, we paid $91.00 for a pretzel, 2 sliders and a philly cheesesteak.   Get it together Uncle Bears!

MhBknnjjMXMfRqf1shXxWg.text: Pretty good, basic bar food. Gluten free bun available for the burgers. My boyfriend got the Ocean Beach IPA and he said it was great! Looks like they have a game room under construction. Overall a good experience.

wichIxMQ4nOVd8-A8_HkPQ.text: Our waitress Hope was the best part of our experience here. She was fantastic. However per the manager here, burnt food is not the kitchens fault.

EAbDVwjqgB9L7lBBJXl1fQ.text: Love their Prime Rib Sliders yummy we have been getting them for the last 10 years and they have stayed consistent.

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Bear's Grill & Tap - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Prime Rib Sliders.  Comes with a few side choicea.

jfIyWWwsrDhsDJYmGOIOUQ.text: I've not been to the brewery itself so I can't speak to the food or the ambiance of the location but I did pick up some of their beer here in Tucson at Total Wine and More and I'll admit I was happy with my choice of purchase. I tried their mandarin wheat and it was very good. I have tried many wheat beers but this one was fruitful without being overwhelmingly sweet. I will definitely be trying more beers from this local AZ brewery!

lHTeAUFIRZslufP_i_DyVw.text: One of my favorite restaurants! The food, beer and service is amazing. We've been going to this location for over a year and a half and everything is always consistently great. It's clean and I love all the pictures of dogs! Dogs eat free on Saturday's (with a meal) so it's fun to bring the fur kids!

qI76MZfKSURCAltzKOoeGw.text: Too bad we heard great things.... but we arrived at 950pm and we waited a good 10 minutes just to be told sorry were closing and recommended a different place very rudely may I add. We specifically checked and the hours are posted as closing at 11 pm so we thought more then enough time to have dinner. Oh well .

ABub4S6xPXPn7_EyMMDfLw.text: A True Ahwatukee staple! This brewery has great food, beer and service. It's also very family friendly. Highly recommend if you haven't tried it!

Yx6jUbosYwrNLA-2YayvUg.text: I love the food here! I literally crave their fish tacos randomly and the lemon chicken sizzle...? Yum!! If you come here, the atmosphere, wait staff and food will not disappoint. Brooke was who we had today, and she was so sweet and attentive. I come back all the time and will continue to.

WBI92AhWft7nNWuwv8KcdA.text: This place is supposed to be extremely dog friendly but our waiter didn't even acknowledge our dog nor offer him a bowl of water--two things that are the norm at dog friendly restaurants. Service was poor, slow and curt; not friendly or helpful at all.   The food was nothing to write home about either. I had a cocktail which wasn't even very good but I guess that's what I get for ordering a cocktail at a brewery.   Wouldn't return nor recommend unless you like their beer.

nQa71CVJCTVbdhI0aRzV0A.text: Had a dope waitress named jules, she was very kind and I will be coming back fasho, they have some bomb food and good service

They'll even put a framed picture of your dog up in the restaurant if you bring them one, which I definitely did! The food is good but a little pricey so I usually go there for happy hour. I REALLY like their mandarin beer.

j5TBOI5UeKSZCSCNna5aeg.text: There are barely words so I'm just going to dive in. I can't begin to describe how delicious the peanut butter cup porter is on draft. It's so smooth and bursting with chocolatey peanut butter flavor.  There's hardly any bitterness which is a quite a feat for a porter like this.  The food was good but not great.  Wing sauce wasn't my favorite and the Mac and cheese was good ol' Kraft but expensive.  The fries that came with the kids meal were amazing though.  I'll have to come back and try something else, but the beer really did blow me away.

1RkdzvRpaseWaIV9-beBUg.text: Reason: end of the week  Service: good  Cool points: dog patio friendly   Food: we had beer, wings and dessert - the BBQ wings were pretty good, I liked the sauce - very tasty - the beer is local and yummy, I ordered the sour, the tropical IPA and the Mandarin IPA - for dessert, we tried the Raspberry Lemonade cheesecake - soooo tasty!

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Bear's Grill & Tap - Phoenix, AZ, United States

uCYZjQAKzJhl6OivNKHFOw.text: Really good beer and wings. Service sucks.  Maybe we came during a shift change or they just suck.   This was our second time and maybe our last unless we sit at the bar and have some beers.

fgGlnDPUClRUH2DJI7AiIg.text: Another great lunch at Uncle Bears on Ray. Had the Herd burger and side salad. The salad is always cold and crisp with NO iceberg lettuce. The Herd burger is one of the best burgers in the valley. Fresh hand pressed beef with lettuce pickle tomato and onion cooked in the patty. Mustard only! I added American cheese to bring a splash of goodness.  Staff is always pleasant and friendly. Dog friendly as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Bear's Grill & Tap - Phoenix, AZ, United States

YF7q7RgN--OUJ-iox4nPhQ.text: Not open at advertised hours. Showed up here for breakfast since hours state they open at 9am. It is 946am and the doors are locked with stools on top of all the tables.  Update your hours. Will not be coming back again since they do not respect their customers' time.

ORsvMnah1PIycmmpLZtqQw.text: I had the pulled pork sandwich.  For $10, there was not a lot of pork on the sandwich.  The bbq sauce was heavy and somewhat sweet - it also overwhelmed the taste of the meat as well as the coleslaw and onion strips that were part of the sandwich.  The sweet potato fries were okay but bland.  The service was good and the booth was comfortable.  They have about 10 different TVs tuned to various sports channels.  The music volume was average for a sports bar.  I probably would not go back simply because the food was very underwhelming.  Bland chain-restaurant quality.  However, they have a much bigger emphasis on burgers than the bbq so perhaps those are better?

PpEUEk6E-gL7V-NeGUfxSQ.text: I enjoy coming here, the atmosphere is great. Nice menu. I was disappointed when they changed the menu and started up charging for options that were originally included. Example- I used to have choice of fish or shrimp tacos. Now it's $3 more if I want shrimp! Bummer. Ordering a bowl of soup is a cup size portion.  I wish they would revise and make it worth the money.

r8a-3rPnYlmjCbKh2WZU1g.text: We were totally bummed when the Uncle Bear's location in Chandler went out of business, so we were interested in trying this location.  I know that they are trying to shy away from being known as a sports bar and are trying to be more well known for brewing, but I really don't think their beer is top quality yet.  I did appreciate the farmhouse saison though because a lot of breweries don't even attempt those.  We like Uncle Bear's for the great Happy Hour and daily specials.  Every seat at the bar is perfect for watching the game.  We love the tostada nachos and the sliders.

aINpVublxQ9fN2zDTCAjaw.text: I came here with a coworker the other day during our lunch hour. It was relatively empty so I kind of expected fast survive. We seated ourselves in the bar area and were greeted about 4 mins later. After reviewing the menu i decided on chips and salsa for an appetizer and the prime rib sliders. After about 20 mins we got out food... however, i was expecting our chips and salsa to come out first. It was, after all, an appetizer in which required no cooking or prepping. When i asked where the chips and salsa were, the waitress acted surprised that we did not get them, apologized, and went to get the order. At this point it was kind of pointless since we already had our food.   The prim rib sliders were somewhat dry. Thank goodness for the juice they provided on the side. Needless to say, I wont be getting them again. The one thing i can say is the portion's are decent for a lunch menu item.   I'm not sure if i will be coming back here or not. I'm all for giving a restaurant a second chance, however, with the combination of service provided, forgetting the chips and salsa, and the quality of the food...this will not be my first choice.

fDVeZ5XmbCsAUofwJ8yWkw.text: We visited this restaurant twice. Trinity was our first server. Aiden was the server on the second visit. We enjoyed both visits. Beer was all good and food generous and tasty. The servers were there when we needed them -- answering our questions and taking care of our requests. It's a great place to stop after a hike or days work.

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Bear's Grill & Tap - Phoenix, AZ, United States

gLWNUpDjWQF8jMoCJ5tGhQ.text: This is a great place!   The waitress we had was so cheerful and happy to have us there! She was very knowledgeable about the beers.   The snacks we had were amazing! One of the best pretzels I have ever had. The cheese sauce is amazing!  We were very pleased with our visit, food, drinks and service!   5 stars for the help!!

6GXdI2xQmdasAPq1tBj17Q.text: The place was nice but the service was terrible. For everything we wanted we had to keep flagging the waitress over for it. Her name was Courtney, so just make sure the next time you come in you ask for two drinks in advance cause your only going to see her once your whole time there. Also it was obvious that the place was laid back with service, from our table you could see into the kitchen, I literally saw the guy cooks playing with each other. The waitresses in their service room were grouped in three leaning back as if there wasn't anything to do out on the floor. The only nice thing about it was the hostess who brought us to the table, although it seemed like nobody knew we were even there, as if we were stumbled upon.  Definitely will not recommend this place, and I love recommending places in Arizona. Ugh. I should of just went to Pita Jungle.

qzBldVhrsXiDwjzIyiDJzQ.text: I am updating my review because I been coming here a lot more considering how close I live. Time and time again my service is wonderful. Last night we came in for some happy hour and tried their hottest wings. I absolutely love wings but what I love most about it is the HEAT that comes with it (if you're into that like I am). We got the scorpion sauce and it was excellent! Perhaps there a little small but it was $4 for half a dozen. They were cooked just right and our taste buds were definitely feelin it. If you're into spicy like I am, order the scorpion sauce with your wings! Will be coming back for more.   I just love the location, the people, and the vibe. The beer choices were excellent! I can't wait to see what kind of beers they'll be brewin in the future! Happy hour is just great! The price is just right!

vzmK3aKLqs04sKKrULGSEA.text: Not much food for the money. Good selection of beers. Smoke alarms went off while we were there because something in the kitchen was burning. We haven't gone back.

ugvKE_nbupGn3yIF7U1GcA.text: Ordered shrimp tacos which were amazing. Fresh salsa with just the right amount of jalapeno. Happy hour from 3-7 Mon - Fri and 9 to close 7 days a week. Kitchen closes at 10 during the week. Love the indoor/outdoor ambience. Good location to watch sports. All the beers are brewed in house and the bartender recommended a Uncle Bears West Coast style IPA. I'm a hop head from CA, so hard to find good West coast style that I am accustomed to around here, they usually have to much malt. This one was pretty good at 6.9% with 60 ibu's. I highly recommend it.

tckk9tYkh5dzkmZ403b51g.text: Cool place for some tasty craft beer. Great selection of beer & food. We started with Chips,Salsa&Guacamole. Guacamole could use a little bit more lemon juice & tasted a bit watered down. Salsa was ok-very peppery. I went with the Prime Rib Philly w/fries. Surprisingly it was delicious!! Very tender, juicy & seasoned well-although a side of horseradish would have been nice. Not bad for my first time there, although the tables in the bar area could have been a bit cleaner...food crumbs. I am willing to return for the beer & sampling of other foods.

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Bear's Grill & Tap - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Prime Rib Philly w/fries.

34G5xagq4RIXse_WlILQwg.text: Out of mimosas and golden ale. Order took a very long time. Disappointed.  Food was good though.

OdFtVHcSDu6E81JgIvNfKg.text: Holy crap, this place is awful. If you are going to have your own beer featured, it better be damn good. Got a flight and they all sucked. Service was slow and it wasn't even half full.

5iyo7zw-tuJo1zdv26SqwQ.text: It's on the good side of average.  Pricing is cheaper than some other similar places,  but the food decent.  I had the wings,  not sure the "retoss" charge was worth it,  seems like a gimmicky upcharge (however they were delicious).  The long Island was delicious.  My boyfriend had the bbq cheeseburger and really enjoyed it. I stole (only) a couple fries, and they were fantastic.    Fun atmosphere, they do love dogs and asu fans. I'll try it again, there was a lot on the menu that looked good.    Xoxo,  Amber

q9Jgyr1xu6ZOc444QrgiXA.text: This place has become my favorite Ahwatukee bar. We really needed something like this in the area. The beer here is always wonderful, my favorite is the Mandarin's Best Friend. It has an amazing citrus flavor and is so refreshing for the summer.   I've tried close to everything on the menu and haven't been disappointed yet. My favorite: blackened chicken sliders. Yum!   Occasionally the service can be a little on the slow side, but if you're looking for a fun, relaxed placed to just hang out...Here it is.

17_nVShGLQ0mlZMJp-JZ7Q.text: Thought we'd give UBBGs a try as we had a 241 lunch coupon, and while the Dog Park Dark Ale was really good and a bargain @ $3 a pint (a daily special) the service was not quite up to par and the good was forgettable. Would give a 2.5 stars if I could.  Decor & Ambiance. Very clean, good atmosphere, and nicely decorated - especially if you are a dog lover - and the music was not too loud. Garage doors allowed the place to be ventilated which is nice this time of year.   Food. Pepperoni and ham pizza: crust could have been a tad crispier, and the sauce was slightly sweet. Beer cheese soup: was more like queso, and needed more flavor from a good stock. Sizzling beef fajita salad: good mixture of greens, but the beef had a slight chili powder flavor, a couple of sprigs of cilantro, some jalapenos, a line wedge for the beef, and a few tortilla strips would have helped a lot - as would have another dressing and the beef not been cooked so much.  Service. Hostesses were very friendly, as was the entire staff. Our waiter however was not quite up to speed as he failed to ask: what side dish we wanted, whether the soup should have been served first rather than as side (yes), type of salad dressing, and degree of doneness for the beef fajitas. Then he failed to catch an overcharge on the bill.   All-in-all, a good place for a beer, but better pub food to be had elsewhere.

h-J0wcFdawY89ldqA8pyqQ.text: Neat atmosphere.  They brew their own beer which you can see in the back.  Lot's of TV's to see what's going on in the sports world.  We ordered the pretzel and an appetizer.  It was really good.  I got the fish tacos which were just OK.  i should have known better than to order these from a non mexican food restaurant.  My son got the crunchy macaroni and cheese and liked it.  The wings were good too.  Lot's of tasty beers to choose from.  I got the sampler tray and tried a few of them.   They were all good.

0Y7BndFICM_HhSTqjg48kA.text: I admit I was surprised - Uncle Bear's is a smallish chain here in the PHX area, and like all chains there's a danger of blandness and too much homogeneity. The beers are fine. The mash tuns and kettles are right behind me, not currently a lot of activity, but the six beers on tap are all tasty!  The bar food (dogs and brats) are good as well, with a lot of variety in toppings. The seasoned fries are crispy but not too much so. The music is awful, I don't even recognize the decade, but it's not memorable... According to helpful waitstaff, there are about 5 Muzak channels they're allowed to pick, but this one is pretty weak. The bar is open to the patio, I chose to sit inside since it's impossible to see the TV screens when outside. Good place and worth a visit!

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Bear's Grill & Tap - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bar special - Chicago Dog and Milwaukee Brat, both loaded!
Photo of Uncle Bear's Grill & Tap - Phoenix, AZ, United States. A flight of Uncle Bear&#39;s offerings: Fence Jumper, Head to Tale, Dog Park, Ocean Beach, and Hop Dog!

nWqZq_Z08GqR--Ibu2MA0A.text: What horrible service and customer service. Just finished having lunch there. We ordered the herd's burger off the lunch menu at $6.99 and even pointed to it. We asked for no cheese, it came out with cheese. After we finsihed and the bill we noticed they charged us for the regular burger $9.99. After letting waiter know he said that it wasn't his fault we ordered the wrong one. He didn't adjust it to the right price or anything.

f1NcgvBYmuKbZpxOdOXMEQ.text: Beer is great, food is pretty good and service is nothing to complain about. I would say if you're in the mood for NOT bar food don't come here.  The beer is made here and it's cool to watch the process, lots of ppl come around, get the fries or wings during happy hour great prices and quality/value.  Definitely better than the Mellow Mushroom across the street.

JDKk9iSfK6m0gppeJIQ_Vw.text: Had a few friends in from out of town and took them here for happy hour and had a blast! They have loads upon loads of craft beers to choose from so everyone ordered a flight to taste. With creative flavors and clever names, it's hard not to enjoy your time here! It was super nice outside so their patio seating was absolutely perfect :)   Our server was incredibly patient, food wasn't anything extraordinary but he did offer more chips with our guacamole and salsa platter. I loved the bone shaped dining and the fireplace was also a great touch! Love how dog friendly this place is too!

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Bear's Grill & Tap - Phoenix, AZ, United States

6anF00AbmshXkZULcJ1TlQ.text: The only reason there are two stars above is for the beer and my husband's Cajun Chicken sandwich which he said was good. Ok, so my husband and I went to Bear's this evening and my meal was truly unfortunate. I ordered the Sizzling Fajita Salad. To be blunt the lettuce was limp, the cheese tasted weird, the chicken was salty, the ranch dressing was watery, and the beef was bland. On top of this to have sour cream and guacamole on the side was an extra $2.75.  I take responsibility for eating most of the salad (I was hungry and was thankfully able to eat some of my husband's fries) but did not enjoy the meal despite really trying to. (How many salad dressing combos can a person create with salsa, ranch, and sour cream?!) I expressed this to the waitress (who was very good and not a part of this negative review) at the end of the meal. She thanked me for my feedback, which I appreciated, and took the situation to the manager. The manager ended up taking $2.10. $2.10 off a $50 meal. That's doesn't even cover the tax. That actually didn't even cover the extra I paid for an attempt at flavor by adding guacamole and sour cream. My husband and I are in agreement that except for an occasional beer or chicken wing there and many other places that actually provide a satisfying beer and a good meal.

JrvdshgmiFt1L6gFKgXoNw.text: I saw this place had been getting more negative reviews lately, but I wanted to find a place where I could sit outside and enjoy a nice patio with my dog. Turns out, it does seem to have gone downhill.  I have not written a review in many years, but I felt the need to after my experience here.  I walked up with my dog and saw the sign on the patio said to please see the host/hostess for seating so I went inside and she said we could find a place to sit on the patio. Great, so I did just that. They had a decent patio and it was not too crowded but there were about 4-5 other dogs with their owners out there. Over 15 minutes went by and no one had come over to give me a menu or ask if I wanted anything.  At about the 20 minute mark, someone finally came over to the table next to me and apologized for it taking so long and said she would get menus. A few minutes later, she came over and said the same to me. She asked if I wanted a drink and I said I had not seen a menu yet. She said she would go get me a menu and a water. OK, that should be good right? Not quite...a guy comes out and hands me the water and says they did not realize I was sitting out here...even though the hostess told me to. He asked if I wanted a drink and I again said I had not even seen a menu yet. He walked off and said "maybe you should have checked in with the hostess first then." OK, I am done with you. I said "nevermind, bye" and took my dog and left. Horrible service, and even worse customer service. One star for having water for dogs already outside.

61sHje-lBlzAq_2rtFnJ8A.text: Love to support local places. We went for a late lunch after a movie. The burgers were great, we ordered the garlic fries and the sweet potatoes, both great. My husband had a beer and was impressed with the Uncle Bear's brews.  I loved the doggie pictures and the waitress was super nice. I would definitely stop by next time we go to the movies.

kdZhgEhnqZEAcgN_DQYHmQ.text: I love this place because it's so relaxing and it has a great combination of things I like: dog friendly, local draft beer, lots of TV's, and good food. Great place to hang out and staff has always been super friendly. Good place to go on a weekend or after work to relax. I tried a seasonal dark ipa and it was pretty good. I must recommend this place.

P1RyMFl1HOdtguaMqDMjAw.text: This was the first time we visited this place. We actually came to watch a movie at AMC Ahwatukee and we had sometime and we were hungry as usual we opened and Yelp and decided to come in here. The server was was very sweet. My wife was certain about what beer she wanted and I was a little fussy so she got me testers and I selected peanut butter cup porter and I loved it. I had the nice flavor of peanut butter and chocolate. For food we had ordered herd burger with veg pattie which she loved. I ordered my favorite chicken wings with two flavors cajun and mango spice. Cajun was okay! But mango sauce was really good. All in all had a good time. Will visit soon!

zeU7rcR566DJiI9msQEWSg.text: Our waitress, Alexis was great, food was ok.  I have been here a few times.  We had the Bbq pizza today, it looked like a frozen pizza and tasted like one.  Beer could have been a little colder. Great service, great atmosphere,  and love all the dog pictures.

TZ5PwTNabNiZnSQ5o0R7yA.text: First time coming here. Came in with a party of 4. We were seated immediately. The restaurant was not even half full. We sat there for 20 minutes and were never approached by a server. I went up to a server and complained after 15 minutes. She said she'd be right over. She never came. The servers were arguing about who's table it was. So we walked out. Never coming back to this place.

CN5KJenT0tL_NI1c-D8x_A.text: Great local pub. As you walk in you will see lots of dog pics everywhere. Uncle bear is the name of the owner's dog I believe. Anyhow, this is great brewery that smells like brewery. It means it needs some solution to get rid of its smell. Its smell can be very uncomfortable time to time. The overall taste of their own collection of bears. I liked it. They have variety of diff bears and I really enjoyed a lot. The french fry is superb and very crispy. Go check it out.

hxi6FaWWzvrCy-MV2XEeug.text: My review for Uncle Bear's is WAY overdue.  I used to work in the area and had many business lunches here about 3-4 years ago, and my husband and I have been here several times after movies at the attached AMC theater.    On our most recent visit I tried the head to tale amber ale ($6) and my Mr. tried the cigar-themed brew ($6).  Both were tasty and the cigar beer had a nice depth of flavor.  That one would be perfect to savor along with a nice smoke.  For my food I had the prime rib Philly with sweet potato fries ($15.65) and he had the Egg Style Herds burger which comes with cheese, bacon, egg, and avocado, and onion rings ($13.65).  My Philly was good, but that burger was excellent.  We went halvsies, but I'm definitely getting that burger all to myself next time.  What a great combination.    Uncle Bear's has always provided friendly, fast service, even for the business lunches I've had here where sometimes there would be 12-15 people in attendance, and the food and beer is excellent as well.  Another beer worth a mention is the peanut butter cup porter.  Nicely done.  Solid place all around.

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Bear's Grill & Tap - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Prime rib philly.
Photo of Uncle Bear's Grill & Tap - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cheeseburger with bacon, egg, &amp; avocado.  Delicious!

wayTrJ_3FkA8sCULFFKBpg.text: Overall, just below average. Details follow.  Service was pretty good and very friendly. Other servers/staff (besides our server and hostess) didn't seem particularly helpful. Service was not quick considering the place was mostly empty. 7 out of 10.  Atmosphere is fair. Strangely laid out, kegs stacked around everywhere and pallets of containers stacked in a main walkway. Smelled a bit like a "working" factory, but not in the good microbrew way. Bathrooms pretty dirty, not terrible. Very open restaurant, but not comfortable feeling. Seems strangely laid out with random tv's strewn around. Atmosphere is 5 of 10.  Food was fair. Was unremarkable (we had appetizers) and tasted like mediocre bar food from other mediocre bars. The beer was actually bad. I tasted 5 to pick my favorite. They all had a skunky aftertaste like most home brewers get in their first few years brewing. None were above average, all were below. I give the food and beer a 3.5 out of 10.  The only saving grace for this place is the pictures of cute dogs on the walls and canine theme.  Overall, I would not return to Uncle Bears. I give it a 4.5 out of 10.

gXb2pwOQfjOm7IRDa67UsQ.text: Great place to eat hang out with friends and you can bring your dog with you!!!  Alexis was a great server and very helpful.  They have their own brewery with many different choices of craft beer.  Excellent service and very friendly environment.  Will definitely come here again.

KgB2SqxeBx6pbIU61nKCxA.text: Came in for quick bite for lunch. Went with there half soup-- beer cheese and there sandwitches BLT. Both tasted great and under 10bucks. My waitress was supper friendly and fast.

T6uY58Q1kQavW9yQ67wQRA.text: Great beer selection in south GILBERT. Service from Katrina and Ashley is excellent. Happy to see they have food truck now.

ttF_8o0hbKQQsv3hm4fAtw.text: Really was not getting the vibe of this place. We came away feeling as if we went to Applebee's and not a really fun brewery. Tukies on chandler, has a much better vibe although does not brew its own beer. Service was meh. Was not asked if the table offered was decent and when we asked for another table waiting 10 minutes to clean was not good. Table was wiped down with same cloth that was wiped on seats.... honestly seriously gross. Will not be back. Y'all are trying the college thing in the wrong area.   Food: felt that it wasn't fresh, tasted like frozen food, was told that we would get a second round of chips but they never came.

NQxfJuE9W7BmU4Ml_x9e2A.text: I love that I can bring my dog here. As a dog-themed brewery, one would hope that would be the case! If I'm with my dog I sit on the patio and always snag some mozzarella sticks and the Head to Tail or Mandarin Wheat beer. I must also say good things about the Peanut Butter Cup Porter though, too! It's more of a desert beer for me, being a thick porter, I'm not sure I could handle more than one.   The bar inside is casual and adorned with tv's so you can keep up with whatever sports event is happening. Everyone here is always super friendly and the dogs I've seen on the patio are usually also, in general, mostly mannered.  I love the cute-dog themed bones and things around the place too. I'm usually stopping in to catch up with friends, pass the time, or just get Hank (my dog) out for an adventure. It's just my kind of hangout, I'll be back!

j01g5uZFa6WFOiYYnR_tdg.text: I continue to love this place with all my dark little heart and I also continue to love that no matter what type of wings you order, if you ask for "extra saucy" it never happens. Ever. And I say this with complete love and it sincerely cracks me up. The new PB&J wings are spectacular! Asked for extra saucy...nope. I'm starting to think it's the kitchens way of being like "order a side of sauce and pay for it, you cheap asshole" and you know what, that is fair.

YxRuMrMxx_UX8_GSPtttlA.text: Absolutely love love LOVE Uncle Bears Brewery! Heads up to all my dog people out there - you will absolutely love this place. The tables are shaped like milk bones and there are photos of dogs everywhere. I think you can bring in a photo of your dog to display on the wall - if that's True somebody LMK because I'd love to display my dogs adorable faces.   It's a watch site for KU basketball games so any place that embraces crazy KU fans (Rock Chalk!) gets a warm reception from me. It's a fantastic place to watch a game. Their food is fantastic (try the garlic parm fries - omg ). They also brew their own beer  which I didn't try but my fiance did and said it was good. He says to try the citrus wheat beer!  The service is also A+ (S/O to the waitress who helped a girl out when I needed a lady product. You the best girl). Everyone who has waited on us there has been awesome.   I'll be back Uncle Bears! Two thumbs up from me.

NMaA9zXLxBaAQt16v85FJg.text: I got the regular hamburger and onion rings. It was delicious. We got a free burger patty for our dogs. I love that dogs are allowed! Good food & great service. Elisa is great! ;)

sRCYKaW9MrXaHZhU2J1qsw.text: Food is decent for bar food. Priced very fair. The beer tastes like something Budweiser would sell as craft. Best thing they have is their hefeweizen. The other beers are not so desirable.  I think they need to reformulate or hire a new head Brewer.   Francis,  I tried all the flagship beers. Minus the double IPA. The mandarin wheat was good. Something about the others did not taste so well. May be its the ingredients?  Possibly the water?  Idk but compared to brewery's  like desert eagle, 8bit, Sonoran, sun up, dubina, fate, Papago, AZWB, or freak n brew to name a few. The beer is very sub par. Nothing stands out. Example...I can name at least 1-2 beers in each brewery that is phenomenal. Something that brings me back for more. AZWB is a far drive from Glendale but I make the trek because of the great beer and superb food. I'm not a snob by any means. This is just an honest observation.

MX02z3bib2T5yUsdAecv3A.text: Needed an after work concoction this is the spot friendly staff comfortable outdoor seating a fire pit nice place to unwind from the daily gridlock we call work. Enjoy

y8Pwa5zcbJN_JVDCeaX1tg.text: BAD FOOD...a beer and burger is $15 and its the worst burger I've ever had.  Don't eat at this place. I gave it one star in order to post...

tupMUFzYdtNvKfsckggtnw.text: I came here on a Monday and my heart stood still Da doo ron-ron-ron, Da doo ron-ron Somebody told me that the Scorpion Sauce kills Da doo ron-ron-ron, Da doo ron-ron  Yeah. I've had beers from this brewery before - once they had their girls pushing caps and shades and free samples over at Fibber McGee's and I found that I really liked their Mandarin Wheat. So this is what I started out with one Monday evening. I was there with a friend who told me their Scorpion Sauce wings were a definite "contendah." I've been meaning to come here ever since I had the wings at Teakwoods. He was curious if the wings at Uncle Bear's could compare. Not that he was gonna take the challenge himself - but he knew I would. LOL. So the moment I ordered the wings grilled and re-tossed with the Scorpion Sauce the waitress got a serious look and asked if I was sure I was sure. Adding, of course, there are no returns/refunds if I can't handle it. Bah. Bring it on I said. Do I need to sign a waiver or something? She smiled and said it wouldn't be a bad idea. *I* was starting maybe this might turn out to be a bad idea. Another waitress came over and asked if I wanted gloves for the wings. I must have rolled my eyes and maybe gave her a look like "are you for real?" Because she immediately told me she was TOTALLY SERIOUS. So I agreed. Maybe that would avoid a tragedy when I accidentally rubbed my eyes later on that night. So when they brought the wings they also had what looked like surgical gloves in another tray. That kinda gave me a little chill like maybe I shoulda also called for a reverend and a hearse as well. So I dug into that first wing. I felt an immediate burn. Oh crap - here it goes but I asked for it. Definite habanero flavor and habanero burn. Instant and ongoing but not enough for me to put the chicken wing down. I got through four wings before I finally needed a swig of Mandarin Wheat in a tall glass. The burn was still ongoing but I made it through most of the wings before I finished my first glass of beer. Not long after I finished the rest of the wings and then finished my garlic parmesan fries I ordered on the side. It was quite a burning sensation in my mouth I admit - that Scorpion Sauce is no slouch. Heck maybe they should be displaying the Scorpion Sauce Material Safety Data Sheet to all challengers. Our waitress told us she was washing her hands really well after grabbing my empty beer glass each time. This is because she witnessed some guy try the Scorpion Sauce wings WITHOUT the gloves once and when he had to go to the men's restroom - well let's just say when he came back he was crying. Oops. I didn't ask for any more details but I was glad I wore the gloves. So how does the Scorpion Sauce rate against my standard for hottest wings (Teakwoods)? HOT. VERY VERY VERY HOT. But not AS hot as Teakwood's. I say this because I had to have TWO swigs of beer after every individual wings at Teakwood's and I finished four tall glasses of beer by the time I was done with all of them. ANd STILL felt the burn in my mouth. So Teakwood's still reigns as the king of hot wings but this is definitely next in line. Of course - judging by my standards. Your mileage may vary. Lotsa parking - it's in a big mall with lots of other stores. Monday night wasn't too crowded but I'm sure the place gets much more packed towards the weekend.

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Bear's Grill & Tap - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wings with Scorpion Sauce. Gloves (on the left) are optional but highly recommended.

9ksvnmHJy8kEUu000aVvQQ.text: We visit Uncle Bears at least twice a month. The draft beers are a great deal for happy hour.  The food is decent bar food. We like to share the fajitas. The beans taste like they are from a can, and most likely are, but the rest of the meal is good. Kids meals are a good value.  Also like the karaoke entertainment. We don't have a dog, but if we did we'd definitely bring it here on the patio. Very dog friendly. A pretty decent place to hang out for a couple of hours with the family.

xC9XbUpTadjHBG-QR0iS_A.text: Love Uncle Bears! The staff are all very nice & friendly! The fact that you can bring your dogs onto the patio outside, is such a great idea!   The pretzel & cheese- you HAVE to get to start with! It's delicious! I've tried a couple different meals... Turkey Avocado (my fav), chicken tenders (pretty good!!), teriyaki chicken sandwich was good, nothing crazy special, the cheeseburger was a pretty big in size! There French fries are extremely tasty!   I've had the wheat beer they brew & it's pretty good.   Favorite servers: Alexis & Courtney!

feitSJ89B_xpb7L9QmviRQ.text: Peanut butter cup porter! Get that beer, it's so good!  Full of flavor! Beer is good, food is good. Never too busy, the service needs some improvement to keep the beer flowing.

YhyqDYCNvxJPjdI4VZia-A.text: Get the Herd burger-it's SOOOO good! I asked for a few modifications on mine and they not only didn't charge me but did just as I asked.
