QRFdFkI0fp6Qi64u8LYYZA.text: Great place to grab a beer and some food.  Beers are brewed on site and it has a great atmosphere with inside and outside seating.

IAkxeMhIb5sFV5XS_Z3TBg.text: This is probably one of my favorite bars in ahwatukee. Selection of domestic beer is good. My favorites Double IPA and west coast IPA. They don't change their beer frequently. I love their sliders,wings and lemon chicken.  They have nice staff who always make you feel welcomed.  They can start keeping Variety of IPA and Pale Ales.

p-6IR5xVcVSIggp2FbIOhw.text: Good food but rushed service. I think I just went on a bad night. I will go back and try them again.

ZRN0SXHMOboLch56EeQd0g.text: Went in last night for a some dinner & drinks, and beer. Drinks were okay.  Beer was good.  Dinner however was terrible!   Ordered the Bacon Cheese fries to start with. The fries were just okay. The cheese ( what lil cheese there was) was over cooked, hard & dried onto the fries.  Ordered Black & blue Burger,  and Grilled Cheese & Bacon sandwich that came with tomato soup.   We waited probably 40 minutes for dinner aftewe finished our appetizer ( we ordered all at once). Food finally came lukewarm.  Cheese on the grilled had sat so long, that by the time I got it,  the cheese was cold,  had melted out onto plate when it was warm,  but from sitting so long it became cold,  and stuck to plate. Bread was just hard and over toasted. Was not a traditional "grilled cheese" rather over toated in toaster with no butter to soften or grill bread.  It came with Bacon if that's what you call the 2" slice on each half. Lol The serving of soup was about 2 oz served in a very tiny tiny dipping bowl lol.. It was cold too!  The Burger came drenched in blue cheese dressing.  So much dressing the the bun was to soggy to pick up! Cold as well!  Dinner sucked...  First time there is the last time there...  Mediocre bar food at best. Overpriced for what we had. Do yourself a favor and go to San Tan Brewery in Chandler. Far more beers to choose from. Food is much more quality and a better price.

NtKVVM2Vql5yO0I6xsqMqQ.text: Server was awesome.  Nice outside seating.   Turkey bacon avocado melt was best i have ever had.

qC67UreJE_gIZUB0llK2_g.text: Scorpion wings are horrible!!! Waited for OVER a hour at Wing Stock to not have my full wing tickets fulfilled because they ran out. And not a sorry from anyone ---no meal ticket for the restaurant no nothing. Wow. Great customer service. I'm glad I sweat my ass for for nothing. I will never go here.

zRegfH-zEgRPTinS9Jf_YA.text: I was just here a week ago yesterday with my girlfriend. I gotta say, Uncle Bears is a nice restaurant out here in Phoenix, Az. It is minutes away from the hotel we were staying at for 3 days. I ordered the Texas style grilled beef burger with a order of fries and a Rasberry ice tea. The atmosphere is great with outdoor seating and the waitress even lit us up a candle at the table. Weather was great, we stopped here at 6:30pm in the afternoon. Waitress was great, she kept checking up on us in which i like. Only downside, fries were awesome, but the burger was just a tad bit bland. Had a bit of lettuce and it seem to have too much mustard on the burger. Meat was a little under seasoned, i think next time i will order something else. Other than that, love the place and atmosphere of people watching. I will be back again on my next trip.

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Bear's Grill & Tap - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Texas style burger and fries in Arizona

L3QZpbvKoBKRew0CmxQXgQ.text: This was my first time eating at Uncle Bears & I'm not really sure if I would eat there again. It seemed like a really good spot to watch a football game though.  My fiance & I shared the queso cup, I liked the chips, but the queso was bland. I would not recommend it. I ordered a hamburger, The Old Fashioned on a wheat bun. The hamburger tasted like mustard, but there didn't seem to be a lot of mustard on the hamburger. The meat seemed to lack seasoning. Maybe I just picked the wrong burger. The fries were really good!  The service I give a 4/5. The drinks were huge which I appreciate. Our server was friendly & checked on us frequently. Also I liked that our meals didn't come 2 seconds after we got the queso.  Over all I wasn't thrilled with my food, but I would consider going again.

8ZFDIc3fngq8gYmPQu1Hbg.text: Very cool place.  Dog friendly, awesome patio, good food and drinks.  Stop in with friends at happy hour on the patio.

D86JKOQfdlvHAkbMt0bSDA.text: The garlic parmesan fries are soooooooo good!  I'd come back just for the fries.  Friendly service, plenty of tv's all around to watch sports and a good variety on the menu were all pluses too.  But seriously, get the fries!

yPJEgQpwijKrDLmtodgDsQ.text: This is my new favorite place. The menu is simple, but with slight twists to the bar classics. I had a Luau Burger that was to die for! Their speciality drink menu is delicious, and they have a great variety of their own beer. The service was prompt, we were seated right away, and everyone seemed genuinely friendly.   You'll find me here again next weekend!

1JNPS4oy5mPDt0cQE-aUkA.text: If your going to expect customers to praise your restaurant when two guests are standing in the front it might help for someone to acknowledge us.  Waiting 5 minutes at front and had no greeting.  Then proceeded to take our own menus into the dining area where we noticed about 6 other tables eating.  We sat down waiting for a server to greet us.  One of the servers on the side looked at us and walked into the back.  After waiting another 5 minutes we left the restaurant.  Don't think I'll be coming back.

gX19lCYaEGrsNc511NF7Ng.text: Bad beer, basic food, higher cost than value. Bar environment here is fine and nice outdoor into bar area but the beer here is no where near good. I did a flight and ordered a Green Flash at the end cause none of their beers would I have twice. Really hoping for a good local micro in this area of Phoenix but we're still waiting. Do yourself a favor if looking for good beer right here and just walk over Mellow.

1J41a4Lxa9KeRGc2u-QeHQ.text: Uncle Bear's is a nice casual neighborhood bar and restaurant.  The food was good, our server was very friendly, and the beer was cold!  One other nice touch, if you're a dog lover is you can bring your pooch with as they're welcome on the patio.

2BstI3-wnGMzgVjzoFcOpw.text: I know most of you read my reviews because I slaughter restaurants on this fine website. Well prepare to be DISAPPOINTED!. This place is AWESOME  Tonight was the first time I had ever been to an Uncle Bears, and I was prepared for another mediocre experience. The parking lot was crowded, however the restaurant shares its parking lot with a movie theater, and two trendy restaurants; Pita Jungle and Ra (sushi). It was Friday night around 5:30 pm, and the place looked very crowded, however we did not have to wait more than 10 minutes for a table. This was very rare considering some of the restaurants in the area have 20-30 minute waits.   The inside is large, however they have it sectioned off so it still feels cozy. I think they are trying to attract an older crowd based on the 70s and 80s music that was playing, but they had no less than 19 flat screens with UFC, MLB playoffs, and college football for the younger crowd. Fun for all.   Our waiter was well dressed & professional and our drinks came out quickly and accurately. Best of all their micro brew was only $4.75 per pint!!!! For our meal my wife and I ordered a bunch of little stuff... Sausage platter, hot wings, pretzel with cheese, and prime rib sliders.  EVERYTHING was good and with large portions for the money. I have had sausage platters at other micro brews and this was the best one I have had in a long time. It comes with a generous helping of a semi-spicy sausage with iceberg lettuce and bread to put the sausage on. The wings were fried to perfection and were large. The pretzel again was large and had a delicious melted cheese. The prime rib sliders were awesome however I think they would be better served with a horseradish mayonnaise. I asked for some horseradish and it came out in record time considering the place was packed.   At the end of our meal one of the owners came over to ask us about our experience. The staff was great, food was great, and it felt like the type of establishment that the owners really put their heart into. My wife and I will definitely be back.

pYYnRIYQ86smw67kKWVluQ.text: Been her a couple of times now. I LOVE their beer. They ONLY serve their OWN beer. Food items are okay but not anything to write home about, nothing special. I DID NOT like their wings at all and would not recommend them. Great atmosphere and a good place to go drink. Food's a lil overpriced but it does sit in Ahwatukee. I highly recommend their "craft brews" that they brew there. Actually that's the ONLY beer you can get is "Uncle Bears" brewed beer. I'll be back but I won't make it a POINT to come here again. Just an okay place to go with friends. TV'S EVERYWHERE! Which makes it a good place to go to watch football. THEY ALLOW DOGS (on the patio and ON a leash") If you take an 8 X 10" picture of your dog AND FRAME it, they'll hang his/her picture up in memoriam! That's REALLY cool

pN3INR4KGsI4Qx3TnEIgCg.text: Sadly My wife forced me to go back to this place to meet with some friends of hers.  Nothing has improved since our last horrible visit and if I could give it zero stars I would. Place was now dirty unlike the last time. It is clear the staff could care less about this place.  Food was still overly salty and covering it up with BBQ sauce doesn't work and the beers were still horrible including their mandarin wheat which is clearly trying to be a rip off of the delicious tasting Papago Orange Blossom. Their IPA tasted like dirty soap water which is surprising since there is apparently no soap around to clean tables off with.

UGKQ3jaRDvN8FiOFw7a1kg.text: Hamburgers are awesome!! Outside patio and you can bring your dogs!! Great beer on tap

O79DGJjhh1Wjydv2emh5kg.text: Beers were okay, food was good, service was a little lax, prices were fair. I like that I can bring my dogs onto the patio.

HTmnueLxINQlkJ8Fhix09w.text: We've taken our Dog to this Uncle Bears many many times and the service is always 5 star, the food is always consistent and the atmosphere is great - would definitely recommend as a cool Ahwatukee hangout!

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Bear's Grill & Tap - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Refill at Uncle Bears!

T1ZfM4eW0BlIo912jKP0CA.text: IPA and prime rib sliders. ... service great and I feel comfortable bring my puppy. P.s. pretzel yummy

-Pzu6_3MSJUvnYzNTG4rCg.text: My husband and I went here for the first time tonight and we really enjoyed our visit. The food was great the service was great and we liked the atmosphere. We will be back again :)

TKKvX6hu2OBgCtQZ-frH0A.text: Spacious restaurant with great outdoor seating. Tried a house made wheat beer, other than being warm it was tasty. I hear some beer is meant to be served warm?...maybe that was one I picked? Meh. Not for me. Scrumptious french fries, even though they aren't fresh cut, they were crispy and awesome. The pulled pork was a bit sweet but still delicious....huge portions! The Mac n cheese and buffalo chicken pizza were also ordered at my table and looked awesome too. BF enjoyed his burger that was on special. OH! The most delicious chipotle mayo!! If you're into that kinda thing....you must order it.

sPi0IfqOnvo7sTtPOMgL6Q.text: Let me start off by saying great restaurant. My family and I come here all the time and we always get good service and good food. I usually order the chicken caesar salad and its so good. The dog theme really brings it together and everywhere you look there's an adorable dog pic. Love this place!

ItxDMrmvG8JyOcyF0Rx6NQ.text: My husband and I have been a couple times.  The beer is good,  but that peanut butter cup porter was outstanding!  The last visit, we came in a Saturday with our pups. We didn't even have to ask,  but the server came out with waters for us and a bowl for our dogs.  Also,  it was dogs eat free (which we didn't know about) and were surprised with a good sized portion for each of our dogs of something they really enjoyed.  The food is good.  The jalapeno poppers are great (even if you don't like spicy) but the teriyaki burger was less than stellar.  However I had the burger with green chile's on it and that was amazing.  If I could,  i'd give 4.5 stars. Service is always friendly and I'm hoping to be there again soon.

1a0RAbC_FWXOu99inzY9AQ.text: Oh my goodness I love this place if I lived closer I probably would be there all the time.  Sat outside bar area at night with the full moon on us and the fireplace going it was very pleasant experience and the Brewery beer samples were amazing.  I ordered the beer cheese soup and was amazed by how good it taste. Last time I ate cheese soup was in North Dakota and always wanted to find some here in Arizona. I would definitely go back to have my choice of brew beer and beer cheese soup. Our bartender was very helpful in helping us out with picking our favorite beer samples and suggesting food.

LsU2WPU801Br6XXu3_ZdmQ.text: This is a great place to go with your dog. The only thing that could be better is being able to see the TV from outside. I was here for a football game last year. Service was good, food was good, beer was good, it was just difficult to see the game. The openings outside fence are also a little wide I think. I'm pretty sure my 35lbs mini Aussie could fit through them if she was off of her leash. If this changes I will certainly update my review!

duaAoQu0BnErGJQdLZyfhQ.text: It is nice and clean with cute dog pictures all around.  I enjoy the open layout On my first visit, I really enjoyed the fajita meat, the tortillas were a bit dry and oldy tasting but oh my gosh, the PRETZEL was AMAZING. If they could make every sandwich or slider on a pretzel roll like that, it would be HEAVEN.   I was told fish tacos were also excellent.  On the second visit the pork was dry and chewy and the beer brewed sauce to go on it was non-existent.  The sandwich got lost in deep fried onion strings and I had to ask for the beer BBQ sauce which was then brought to me in a tiny plastic cup. The cheese dip was standard Velveeta like process cheese, nothing special.  Chips slightly staley tasting.  The wings were not very good due to soggy skins, too little sauce, hardly any taste and kind of chewy and too lightly flavored; just not right.    The specialty drink I ordered was good at a price of $7.50 and not very big at all.  They brought it in a Martini glass and it was definitely not a martini drink.  It should have been alot larger for the price.  The beer list is not as extensive as Mellow Mushroom across the street.  The service was great.  The music was odd but they changed it after I asked. Something young people without money might listen to.   The lighting can be interesting at certain tables.  First visit was a 5 star but this second visit was nothing special at all.  For my 2 visits, this averages to an A-OK.

25yQUkSM_-AVzjN1Ja9UWw.text: Summary: much better this time around. Great microbrews. The pretzel with dip is ridiculous. I had the pulled pork sliders. They were dry and salty. Pass on them. Service was descent. Good atmosphere with a live band followed by karaoke.

Kj4f-_BWOwwcTL5TA7TV1g.text: Tasty food and drinks, serve all what you want, lots of choices for dine-in & take out, always crowded, scenery nice.

S1zkMIEzHJwTKdUX6TwmBw.text: This was my 3rd or 4th visit to Uncle Bear's, and considering that I live over a 1000 miles away I guess that says something about my liking the place.  I first heard about Uncle Bear's when they replied to a tweet I had posted while enjoying a craft beer at a nearby bar, the tweet was courtesy of the Untappd app.  While I wasn't able to make it in on that trip to Arizona, I was the next, I travel to Arizona regularly and used to live there.  The first thing that I liked about Uncle Bears is that they are not only dog themed, they are very dog friendly with dogs being allowed in the patio seating area, as a dog lover that was a real selling point for me.  As a beer lover, I am always interested in trying local craft beers, and I can say that the offerings from Uncle Bear's have been enjoyable on all occasions.  While I have only sat at the bar, or out on the patio, the service has always been excellent, and in the case of this past week, beyond what I might experience at other bars.  Even though I live in the Pacific Northwest, and I do enjoy an IPA, porters and stouts are my variety of choice and when I saw that they had a Peanut Butter Cup Porter on the menu I was pretty excited to try it.  Sadly, they were having a problem with the keg/tap and that one wasn't pouring correctly.  Deciding to go with the stereotype of being from the Pacific Northwest, I went with the West Coast IPA, which was very good.  After a couple beers I was pretty much done for the evening, and just as I was about to settle my bill, they got the tap working again and the server, who I don't remember the name, brought me a sample of the porter as he knew that I was disappointed  that it wasn't available when I arrived.  IMO, that is a very attentive bar tender.

StNn0UFnAvwXwgJQHKpojw.text: If you like dogs.... This is the spot for you. I am not a dog person, nor do I eat pork so I was a bit disappointed. I ordered a turkey avocado sandwich with no bacon. I will say the beer battered fried were delicious. I enjoyed that part.

B6UKPV3ATdO_AAq06T-6Gw.text: Unfortunately, we were quite disappointed in the food but the beer was excellent.  We ordered fish & chips which was like what you buy in the grocery store frozen food, pizza that was made wrong (caught by server though before serving) and had to be remade, spicy chicken tacos served on cold flour tortillas and a burger which was ok but overpriced. We all had finished eating when the personal pizza finally arrived, sadly not very tasty. This place is close to our house so we were hoping to find a new restaurant to frequent.

m18AOzyxTNAqowqjL55T5A.text: The beer is excellent. The service is good. The atmosphere is awesome especially if you want to bring your hound with you. Check it out!

TmQYWPbtsBmyHg6vmGpKug.text: We really enjoy Uncle Bear's. We'll take our dog and sit out on the patio. They are very accommodating for fur babies, bringing out water for them and what not. The service is usually pretty good, as is the food. They have a decent selection of bar food. I always get the beer cheese soup, it's delicious! It's a great atmosphere, my only complaint is sometimes during late night hours the service starts to slack a bit. (Only sometimes though.) This place is definitely worth a try!

MXfm7F3-fV5lSSN_z2Un3w.text: Took my pooch here after a lovely hike on a South Mountain. We were looking for a dog friendly place, and we ran across this gem :-) Beer was fantastic, service was great, and my rottie felt at home on the patio. We will be back!

9prmR_5rgvZBN9pm8mzveQ.text: Just got in to Phoenix on my way to Tucson so decided to grab a quick lunch. Pulled off I-10 for Chick-Fil-a sandwich but stumbled across Uncle Bear's. Grabbed a Turkey w/avacado melt and an Amber Ale. Great food and drink. Wish I could stay to try a few more of their brews. Dammit! Definitely worth the stop.

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Bear's Grill & Tap - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ls5uopYeHYNOFZd_XyFz8w.text: This place is great to grab a drink and an appetizer! They always have really friendly service and we love bringing our dog here! Their outside area is very nice as well.

bpLnFFqMAHeUeF0xMZuSYA.text: They Brew Beer.  Now that I have your attention, let me just say that besides the whole brewing beer thing, this place is pretty cool.   I came on a night where the New Phoenix Times was hosting an event for the tapping of a new beer, so the place was buzzing. The also had live music to boot. Lots of people.  The Tukee Town Brown (the newly tapped beer that night) was ok... but not something I would frequently drink. Their Ocean Beach IPA was awesome though. Full of hoppiness and flavor. I would come back even if it were only to get some more of that beer.  I ordered a chicken sandwich with fries for dinner. The food is decent. Pretty standard pub grub. Enjoyable and satisfying enough to help slow down the alcohol absorption.   Overall, I had a fun time. And it's another AZ craft brewery checked off my list!

Photo of Uncle Bear's Grill & Tap - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Outside

ldTtzypV1K2OXPDNSQgtyw.text: Uncle Bear's was great for a quick afternoon lunch. I was a fan of their dog-themed restaurant (dog pictures everywhere on their walls), and their efficient service.   The food comes in pretty decent portions, we ordered two entrees which had enough food to serve all 4 of us in our party (although we were not too hungry). I ordered the pulled pork sandwich with sweet potato fries, and really enjoyed the sandwich. Pulled pork is my favorite, and they have a good combo of pulled pork, BBQ sauce, cole slaw, and fried onions on theirs. The fries were decent and on the greasier side.  I also had a bite of the prime rib sliders, which were pretty yummy!  It wasn't my favorite lunch, but it was good for a sandwich and a quick eat in the middle of the day.

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Bear's Grill & Tap - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pulled pork sandwich with sweet potato fries

ofDWRQ-1b2Hg_GR1gpUU-w.text: I am writing this review as I go. The staff  is friendly,  and the restaurant is not too loud, and clean. The beer cheese soup is in the top two I have ever had.

pP2srwvm4i4FXPWJt2y5iA.text: The asian salad here is really delicious! Its a great before - practice meal. The waiters and waitresses are quick and attentive. Their iced tea is also very good. The sliders are amazing! I've had the T. C sliders and its like a mini burger! I suggest getting a side of mayo or chipotle mayo and some ranch for the tasty fries. The wings are great too! If you get them double tossed it makes them even better. Its where they grill them after they fry them. Delicious! I'm only 13 and haven't had beer... But I've heard from my parents that the beer is pretty good!

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Bear's Grill & Tap - Phoenix, AZ, United States

iu7QXLQ6GCn30rmPEwIsww.text: Oh what can I say about Uncle Bears?  Beer is great and they let you have dogs on the patio!!!  Any restaurant that allows dogs on their patio is thumbs up with me.   My favorite are all of the pictures of dogs throughout the restaurant. Some of the dogs are so cute it's hard to describe it.   Sometimes it seems like the french fries are cooked in oil that is slightly under temperature so they are greasy and soggy.  They have great happy hour specials and other than soggy french fries foods pretty good.   Only been there a few times so far and every time the servers have been absolutely just the biggest dolls on the planet. Fun place to go to have local craft beer, hang out with your pups and maybe even catch a game!

YRSrtfI0IpGuQ3gX2rpKww.text: This place continues to be a huge disappointment due to extremely poor service and undercooked food. We've given this place several tries, because it's in our neighborhood. However, our last bar visit was the worst. How can a bartender at 3:30 pm on a Tuesday ignore the only customers at her bar? Well, she did! After several attempts to get a drink, she finally strolled over and took our order. But asking her to switch ONE television to the Diamondback game proved to be too much to ask. After asking twice, and getting scolded ("I can only do one thing at a time!!!"), she switched to a baseball highlights station. Not Fox Sports. Then, refused to check on her only customers at the bar, because another employee got new glasses, and they chatted for the next 10 minutes about that stupid stuff. Honestly, I can't say enough bad things about this place. Three strikes & you're out!

9Nn6P7uTmSwWHoiBsiMFHA.text: Big food menu, beer is pretty good. Went here before the movies. Peanut butter porter is good

aLB4F1zf_crp_I6_ban2nA.text: Food, beer, atmosphere, staff....all deserve 5 stars. I love that I can sit on the patio with my dog, and have a LOCAL beer. My first experience was great, and my server Alexis was on top of it! They do have other beers aside from their own, and also "dogs eat free" on Saturdays. My pup was able to have a doggie patty while I had my burger. An enjoyable experience!

NOT EVERYTHING NEEDS BACON.  The grilled cheese, the mac and cheese, and my Caesar salad had bacon.  And it was hard and chewy.  But, if anything, the fries were pretty dope.  Stick to their deep fried/bar food selections :D

AiwrH0nGkzkASti5IPTfUg.text: Had a Club Happy Hour at this place. The beer which is a microbrew was very good. Did not have a chance to have a full meal so can't comment on on quality or taste. Some of my friends did have meals and their inputs were favorable. Need another visit to really evaluate.

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Bear's Grill & Tap - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Main Bar

mVHbnbbXvOYuMo-ZYyk9yQ.text: Despite the western-Chandler location, I am an absolute advocate for Uncle Bear's! I've been coming for a few years off and on as it's been a relative middle ground for a friend and I to visit [before I moved to the Valley]. I recently took some former coworkers there as they were in Phoenix for a quick 1-night stay before heading back to Indianapolis. Once we were in town for a karaoke night which was 10000 barrels of fun - not a lot of people so we got to sing a few songs and make fools of ourselves.   Every time I've visited, I've always had phenomenal service - whether sitting in the bar area or restaurant area. The staff know when to come by and ask how we are, what to recommend based on preferences, etc etc. The management deserves a round o' applause for that.   Consistency is also a thing of beauty at Uncle Bear's. I pretty much order the same drink every time [one of the $5 Deep Eddy's] but the people I've been around have raved about their beer... which I know is sad that I order a vodka drink at a brewery, but they're delicious! The food menu has quite a selection. You can never be too sure if a place has a lot of options [sometimes it'll be good pizza, but not good burgers, etc] but they do well there too! The ex-coworkers and I got a variety of things [burgers, fried stuff, pizza, etc] and everyone raved about it!

pBNKUhm-kVtOJm0D-u4DtA.text: One of my personal local brewery favorites in the Phoenix area, this place delivers especially for dog lovers. My girlfriend and I have come here for over 4 years now and constantly brought our Pomerianian Mia who just loved the hang on the patio area. Great food, awesome beer (IPA, Hefe, and Peanut Butter Cup), and great service with some friendly dog loving people.

5Zt0bdsE8NwVv6IADkiq9w.text: Great local hang out, tons of beers, wine, and cocktails! Food was great and service was outstanding. Good look at this brewery!

mtj5IfyykqR1Y3F_2oF4MA.text: Awesome!!!!! Love this place the service was amazing! The food was delicious and the beer wow just wow! You must try the mandarin beer it was so yummy, I had to take a growler home! Love all the doggie photos everywhere!!

eJ8WSr7qEqpopjXCyMf0ug.text: Ahwatukee's Best for the Pups!!  We have a 5 year old dachshund who lives for Uncle Bears. Their outdoor patio is very accommodating to the doggies and has working misters during the summer months. Their food and craft brew (names after dogs btw) is good as well. Whether you have your best friend with you or not, definitely check out Uncle Bears.

tUw_zZ7c9oEXF4piY5GNpw.text: Came here yesterday for my daughter's birthday. I had a Asian chicken salad and it was amazing

h08EcLKYE6dv9VEq-mVy-g.text: Our first time here was perfect. We are within walking distance from our home. I tried a few different beers, all were great especially the peanut butter cup porter. I also bought a six pack to bring home to drink and share with friends. I tried their chili, it was excellent! Also tried fried avocado, it sounds weird but it was great. Last we had the wings, also great. I will definitely be back with my family and our Rottie Lola.

E4B4EVDNxE8wMc_gBpvjzw.text: This is in a very good location in Ahwatukee. It's fun that they allow dogs on the patio. Uncle Bear is the name of the owner's dog. There are dog pictures all over. They will hang up a picture of your dog if you bring in an 8X10 photo in a black frame..  Lots of TV's with various sports....  This is also a brewery. I had the mandarin wheat... VERY good. Companion had the Imperial Stout.... also very good. We shared a pizza. Surprisingly, it was very good. Just enough for the 2 of us. Service was excellent.   I would have given this more stars..... HOWEVER, there was a roach running around on our table after we ate. We were unsuccessful in slaying it, and then I kept thinking it was going to crawl on me, so we left..... :-(

6IY4I2JIICR-JDHJzmoPKA.text: To say I was underwhelmed would be quite an overstatement.  Came in at 2:00 on a Tuesday (so not very crowded) but you would think they were packed given the level of service we received.   Here are the highlights: * Sat for over 10 minutes waiting to be greeted by a server.  I had to go to the hostess stand and have them track down our server. * Ordered the Mandarin Wheat Pale Ale and it was flat and watery so sent it back * Ordered the Bear's Beach Bum - WAY too much grapefruit.   It completely overpowered the beer.   *  Cheeseburger was not impressive *  Waited 15 minutes for server to bring check and finally had to track him down so we could finally leave  This is definitely somewhere we would NOT return.  Bad beer, bad service, bland food.  Do yourself a favor and go to Four Peaks or SanTan Brewery.  They are MUCH, MUCH better.

58RV7em3j41-ofvAEvQzlQ.text: This will be the second time I've gone to this restaurant and BOTH occasions were GREAT experiences. I'm a huge fan of BBQ, so it only made sense to order the "eureka springs" BBQ pulled pork with coleslaw sandwich and a side of beer battered fries! Absolutely delicious, sweet BBQ with perfectly made coleslaw and onion string between two brioche buns!   I am pro-carbs so along with the beer battered fries as a side, I also ordered the baked pretzel (comes with creamy cheese and mustard sauces). The pretzel tasted freshly made, soft and warm upon arrival.   Pro: pretty affordable meal in my opinion (burger is $10 and change, pretzel $6-$7).  Con: Because the sandwich is pretty hefty with pork, coleslaw and onion strings.. the bottom bun isn't really able to hold it all together so if you were to lift the burger and take a bite in, the bun would essentially collapse and break apart (which happened to me.) again, it's not necessarily a dainty pretty meal you'd eat on a first date, so prepare to get your hands dirty but also prepare to use a fork and knife to gather all that goodness together.  This place is dog friendly, has various selections of beers and has pretty good customer service.

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Bear's Grill & Tap - Phoenix, AZ, United States. GAME TIME

YYGAjmiYe4NhIGQyXudsLQ.text: We used to love this place! But with the recent food changes it's not really one on our radar anymore sadly. They really should go back to what they were doing before the quality was much much better!

yg-F_3Tj7RGTZkPENTBSCg.text: Food was good, drinks were okay.  Ambience and TV availability was satisfactory.    However, sitting at the bar with a family with two young teens put a damper on the evening.  I felt like I had to watch my language and the subject of my conversations.  If I had wanted to watch a game at Chuck E. Cheese, I would have made other arrangements.  How inappropriate!    The kids finally left with their dad, but the mom continued to pound down her beers with her now off-duty bartender friend, whose dirty work clothes are sitting on the bar.  So incredibly gauche.  Because the bartender has so little respect for her work place, I am choosing not to contact the manager.  How disappointing!

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Bear's Grill & Tap - Phoenix, AZ, United States. dirty bar clothes!

AK0DI5xhUsWEHbaJ7ZtoBA.text: I am torn here for my score. On some aspects of the evening they were average, but a few things did not sit well with me. Wait time just at the bar was extremely long.  The bar staff struggle with good descriptions of the beers and could not recommend.  After that the food was tasty, kind of the Red Robin type level.  Nothing to special nothing awful.  Just average. My last comment is very bias as I am a proud S-upporter of N-ative O-regon B-eer and I was not impressed with the brews here. Sorry it stay a 60% in my book.

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Bear's Grill & Tap - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Uncle Bear's Grill & Tap - Phoenix, AZ, United States

4kAXjqwBiSzqvcwEFhY4Qw.text: Very tasty wings! You must come try the wings! I've heard of their scorpion sauce made with ghost peppers but I'm not brave enough to try. A friend of mine made the mistake of trying one before his actual meal and couldn't enjoy or taste his food. Don't do that.   Service is good, beer is cold, and the raised booths are cool.

ULKvc7KPoZpOS2ykMGJQ2w.text: Knowledgeable waiter.  Spicy chicken tacos were very good.  The beer was great.  I did a flight.  My favorites were the Irish red and the Peanutbutter porter

slXtBuR3q7BzGo1tfsqAxA.text: This place is place where you can call home. They get to know you, always remember your name, your favorite drink, your favorite meal and even what's happening in your life. If you come you must go to the bar and visit Larry! He is always working during the week and he'll always make your day or night whether he has his hat or glass on ;) (inside joke). Plus it's always great to look at all the puppies on the wall. Shoot you can bring your own dog outside and bring a picture in cause they'll hang your perfect pet up. Best place ever!

AsVCAbQBIiuplCMlmZ8d8w.text: So, unfortunately towards the end of my stay in Arizona I had dinner here.  I say unfortunately because I would of come here several times before had I known this place was this good.  I was here for work so no drinks but I ordered the PBandJ Burger on a pretzel bun.  Not only had I never ordered such a burger I never had a pretzel bun and was a bit skeptical.  Man this burger delivered! It was incredibly tasty and the pretzel bun was perfect.  The beer battered fries were perfect too.  What a great place.  My service from Brittney was awesome, she was attentive and gave great recommendations.

Vj80BTrvrPXGsDstq1n9Hg.text: This is a great place to hang out with a group, lots of space.  I had fish tacos but they were nothing special.  Happy hour or drinks while watching your game of choice is likely a better option.

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Bear's Grill & Tap - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lemon chicken sizzle - a tad too much sauce.
Photo of Uncle Bear's Grill & Tap - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Avocado turkey melt - tasty.

vndVhjWuQ0cgvGw606C0zw.text: Tried to enjoy a nice dinner, but finding a parking place here is impossible!  Finally parked across the street, and walked over. Enter the restaurant, and even with 2 hostess, they can't figure out we are next in line!  Other patron says "I think they were next", and hostess responds "no, they've been helped"...  actually we weren't helped, until now!  By the friendly yummy smelling restaurant across the street! Service has gone done hill here, and won't be back!

_IT0t-nHm_suMU-qHn51cw.text: We came here to watch football on Sunday. Good crowd, good beer and good vibe. We had the philly sandwich. Service was pretty good, but there is only one bartender so hard for her to keep up by herself. Overall good experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Bear's Grill & Tap - Phoenix, AZ, United States

AyQjAG97LysyGCo5PB3byA.text: i have literally never had a bad lunch at this joint.  The bartenders and servers are fantastic, always attentive and even laugh (well smirk) at my quirky and goofy jokes!  I love the pretzels but order them with the queso instead of the regular cheese dip!  I also love the wings.  I had mine medium and grilled then tossed and then sprinkled with Blue Cheese crumbles!  They should put that concoction on the menu!  Great craft beers too!  If you haven't been for lunch, I highly recommend it, thinking about going back to try out happy hour one day soon!  Thanks to everyone that has been making my lunch hour a great hour.

oJozsP8fMB2FOwzhgcVROA.text: First time here. Saw one the owners or brewmaster at a beer tasting event and learned it was here. This is a great place and great location. There is live music on the patio. Am looking forward to future visits. Had the amber ale and my partner had the ocean beach IPA.

iEo8R20YnJCWeKNVW4rwxA.text: Been here twice, order was wrong twice. Yes it happens but both times? I want to like this place, it's close by, decent menu for Sunday football....

3EjUPUhZBFaQM3KUPYuSsQ.text: I have been to this location twice now. The service is slow, unattentive, and lacking passion. If you brew your own beer, you should probably talk about that. If you cared about your guests you would serve them better than a Denny's server. The servers job is easy. Be knowledgable, provide drink refills, engage with your customers, and show some love for the business you represent. Is that so hard? The staff here seemed more concerned with watching the football game then taking care of customers. Next time I will pass on Uncle Bears!!!

qwJP0fkv7noP5aECBuoVqQ.text: Uncle bears is pretty standard as far as breweries go. The food was what you would expect, filling and somewhat greasy. The service was great, she was very patient with me wanting to try multiple beers before picking one that I liked. It's also pretty cool that they allow dogs on the patio! San tan and four peaks are better, but overall it wasn't a bad place.

EAa7bldJSb7AoYrDGiMoCA.text: Went here for a happy hour and was very disappointed with the food and service. We even had to call the manager over. Hopefully it was just that one time. The 2 stars are only for the beer and atmosphere!

1EdzJI6YYziJBNaGPbUXeg.text: TERRIBLE.  Service was average but the food was not good. I don't know how this place stays busy maybe it was just a bad day when I went. But the food was to greasy and and did not have good flavor I will not return.

P-eXT6c26j1mJ3r7K3vYPg.text: Nice Atmosphere for food and beer. Little slow on service at the start but got better toward the stay. Nice selection and tasty beers. Allot of TV's and the food was just fine. Good place.

xqkqdR8pbTl9F_Iq_Tl3HA.text: I like the concept, but the execution is a bit lack luster. Friendly service, decent beer, average food. I'd still come back. Mutts nuts double IPA is too strong. BLT the bread and Chipotle mayo is great, but the bacon was over cooked. Great sounding grilled cheese was just OK... add tomatoes? The cole slaw was made yesterday and needed salt and pepper to taste better.

H8x9sh0-UZC2e_-PlU6QfA.text: Stopped in after a movie and had a great waiter & great food. The mandarin beer was amazing, as well as the sliders!

JI_s9n224iQwYG0DmENfHQ.text: Clean place, great selection of beers, very good food, great service AND a dog friendly patio!

rorw-r5hLJwQ0uLK57eYIQ.text: Second time visiting this place, our first visit we just tried a brew after a movie, liked the place and decided we should come back to try their menu. Not your standard sports bar menu, they have vegan & gluten-free choices and they also have cheese boards and flatbreads that stood out but I did not try as I was starving. Husband & I both had burgers. I had the New Mexico with green chiles, pepper jack & onion strings on wheat bun- it was pretty good, patty was big, greasy & tasty although it could have been cooked just a tad more, (menu says they cook patties to medium-well but it was still a bit too pink, but tasty nonetheless) beer-battered fries were perfectly seasoned and crispy A+. If you like hops in your beer I definitely recommend their house IPA. Service was great & food was served up quick.

ATqFZa39aC63fkdlpDHXHg.text: Definitely not impressed with the quality of the food here. I stopped in before catching a movie and wanted something simple. Got a turkey sandwich and the cheese soup...Both mediocre at best. The bread was not lightly toasted, rather soaked in oil from the grill. I got stomach pains from the grease about a half hour into the movie.  The turkey tasted super processed and was a strange hue of pink..far from what I was expecting. The soup was really bitter..A sign of too much beer in it. My friend got the mac and cheese, which was much better so if I go again I'll probably only get that.

9jdNXygwNVkT4WXfXmrbAw.text: I've only ever gotten the grilled cheese and soup here- I've been twice but I just HAD to get it a second time because it was SO GOOD the first time! But if I'm being honest, the grilled cheese alone is enough to deserve 5 stars. The sandwich, the tomato bisque, and the fries were all exceptional. The atmosphere was nice, but then again I wasn't really paying much attention to anything other than the emotional connection I was having with my otherworldly grilled cheese sandwich. The host and wait staff has also been very pleasant and attentive both times. Also a plus that they're so welcoming to doggies (wish I could bring my dogs out in public without experiencing Non-stop Barkfest 2k16).

Lk2yLwODQqVpFsb_ik4-Xw.text: This location is great. I have been to all there other locations. They are all decent but this one is my favorite. The bands, the customers, the staff and the home brew. All 5 star. Very cool place to take people from out of town. My favorite place to sit is in the bar but anyplace is a good place to sit. They will also teach you about home brewing.

lhzDm1eTD_zX8pylXsnLxg.text: Came here yesterday to meet my husband for a drink and finish watching Seahawks game. I was not impressed with any of the beers we sampled. too light or too dark, couldn't find one that was just perfect. My husband had the wings and said they were too saucy. Cool bar are, with dogs allowed on patio is a definite plus! Over all a good place to watch a game and have a beer with your dog.

gZ6abHhvm3IA5jJtlWC0eg.text: Cold food terrible service!  Not busy so no excuse, waiter didn't come back to table and finally had to ask another to cash us out.  Chili was cold, hamburger and fries were cold, no ketchup.

MfiJr67_3BBaA-yjEHrtCw.text: The waitress forgot about us.  She ordered our beer, but I brought it to the table myself.  She never came back until I went to the hostess to complain.  The situation was soon rectified by a manager and a waiter that took care of things from there out.  They bought us a round, the food came and then the place was enjoyable.  The OB Fish Platter with Cod, was tasty.  It wasn't "BIG" like the menu said, but tasty for fried fish and fries.  The Margherita Pizza topped with arrugula was tasty, but not out of this world.  The dog friendly theme and patio were cute.  I'd try it again, but I'm probably going to sit at the bar, so my beer doesn't get warm waiting for delivery to the table by an overworked waitress.

zFAeXrOj4poRZD8lcxzqDQ.text: I've ate here on several occasions always friendly staff. The food is excellent pulled pork sandwich tastes great. Their servings are big enough to share or take leftovers home. Busy shopping center great location to sit on the patio.

43vMoNMx9nzgf4nnNHXGBA.text: I'm not usually one to leave negative reviews and usually give the benefit of the doubt when I have one bad experience, but our family came here and finally left after waiting forever and never getting served. Too bad, because I LOVE places like this and have heard great things.

Ek8X4jIKr1TVQ8RK9JxBiA.text: Beer is supposed to be cold right !?  I'm here with 3 other people and all of our beers are just barely cold.   Atmosphere is cool and food is not bad but the beer and not cold and that is a must go any beer drinker.  This is not Germany.

LJReoQbEkToSpBrzlRGHOg.text: Food was ok. My complaint is that they serve the beer in warm mugs/glasses. I think the beer might be delicious but if you order a tall (mug) the glass was as warm as if out of the dishwasher. This of course warmed the beer up. I ordered a regular pint also but this glass was also not chilled.  Surprising because well, it's a brewery. I'd expect care to be taken in serving cold beer.

zBbdEnpgOeTnUD3V0ph6HA.text: I happened to walk by here a few weeks ago and saw that something was going in this spot, which has been a black hole for restaurants over the years. I happened to walk by again the other night and saw the place was open so decided to try it out last night.  It was a nice night to sit on the patio, and others had the same idea. Not too many people inside but the place is new. The outside patio had a smoking area and a smaller non smoking area. There was no space in the non smoking area, and the bar had no seats so I was thinking of leaving because I really wanted to sit outside. They caught us before we left and found stools for us which I thought was nice.  The beers were interesting, and I am looking forward to a few weeks from now when they start having porters and stouts.  I had the Mac and cheese and it was very good. There was a solid bacon flavor in there and they somehow kept the bacon crispy throughout the dish. Nicely done. My old lady had a pizza which I wasn't crazy about but I am really picky about pizza.  So I don't expect much from bar pizza.  The staff was quite nice.  All in all, a good experience. I think I will be back.

wB5OtNSXZzY9SlfRCssHuA.text: This was my third visit to Uncle Bear's and most likely my last. The service was incredibly slow from the beginning.  My family arrived before me and asked to be seated at an outdoor patio table when one became available.  Two outdoor tables became available shortly after I arrived.  I watched the two tables being cleared and the girl at the reception desk hadn't notice the empty tables until my son said he'd bus the table if it meant we could be seated for lunch.  That's when the girl behind the desk said she was waiting for the table to be cleared and I told her they were cleared.  That's when she  picked up some menus and walked us to the outdoor patio.    Justin was our server and he seemed new and completely out of his element--perhaps just learning or not the right job for him.  He asked if we wanted to order and I asked if they had a Sauvignon Blanc and he looked at me blankly so I told him it was a white wine and he said he didn't know and pointed to the drink menu and said "the wine is on there."    I ordered the Asian chicken salad with dressing on the side: it came with the dressing on the salad.  Justin told me there was another one in the back and he'd get it for me and I said okay at first then thought it better to keep this one because there was no telling when he'd actually make it back to the table.  The chicken coating was so hard I could barely cut it with my knife.  Thankfully the lettuce was good or I wouldn't have had anything to eat.  My son had the fajitas and his tortillas were old, dry, and hard.  My daughter-in-law had the lettuce pork wraps and the lettuce was so wet her lap quickly filled with the excess water.  The only one at our table who did not have a complaint about their food was my four year-old granddaughter who ordered the cheese pizza.  When I suggested to my son that he ask for fresher tortillas, he said "no, I know as a former server what servers do to food that people send back.  I'll just eat the old and hard tortillas, but I don't like this place anymore."    If it was possible to not have to select one star to post a review I would have done it.  This place didn't earn or deserve even one star today.

xqaik8y3TqDSVIOEjpn7Rg.text: This restaurant was awful.  We waited to be told it was open seating. Sat down, restaurant was empty and waited 10 min for our waitress. Ordered Chicken wings and mac and cheese.  Wings were cold and under cooked and mac cheese was gross.  Service was terrible as was the food.  STAY AWAY!!!

vLWVMhMjAwgNMUdABjQybA.text: Our server seemed a little unsure of himself, but he tried really hard.  Since they just opened, we expected that. The beer was much better than I expected and the burgers were very good. I think this place will be a favorite of ours.

o4vg8py4WJafytBq_Owshw.text: The food is excellent, they had all of the gluten free stuff for my wife an she lives it. Plus they had all of the things I love too. Not to mention beer beer beer and more beer. Try the flights... Now enough about the food. The staff is very very friendly an attentive to our needs. All I can say is that this has been a great night out and this is my new favorite place.

3R8vTK-WYzAmbAT-y4jOPw.text: My experience wasn't good. Ordered food to go and was told on the phone 15-20 minutes, which was fine. Arrived at the restaurant 30 minutes after the call and the food wasn't ready, but was told it was almost done. Over 20 minutes later the food arrived, but when I got it home it was barely warm. My guess was at least part of it was sitting around for a while, waiting for some other part of the meal they forgot about to be finished. A manager showed up near the end of the wait, and then disappeared to look for the food, which showed up why he was gone. Never saw or heard from him after he went to look for the food. This wouldn't have been quite as bad if they had just said they screwed up and it wasn't ready. Instead, they kept saying it was almost ready, which wasn't True. Hard to evaluate the quality of the food since it had sat around so long. I doubt I will be back except maybe to try some of the beers.
